title: UX Designer
description:
### **Din nya roll**


Vi söker nu en erfaren **UX Designer** till vår kund för att stötta den fortsatta utvecklingen av deras interna portal. Här får du en nyckelroll i att skapa högkvalitativa användarupplevelser baserat på insikter från användarstudier och datadriven design.


Du kommer att arbeta både strategiskt och operativt med UX-flöden, användarinsikter och löpande förbättringar, i nära samarbete med UX Lead, övriga designers och produktteamet. Rollen innefattar även att hantera förväntningar från olika intressenter och säkerställa att lösningarna möter både användarnas behov och verksamhetens mål.

### **För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll behöver du**

* Gedigen erfarenhet inom UX och trygghet i att leda och genomföra användarcentrerade designprocesser.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Figma och designsystem.
* Erfarenhet av agilt arbete och nära samarbete med utvecklingsteam.
* Förmåga att omvandla användar- och affärsbehov till tydliga, intuitiva och tillgängliga designlösningar.
* Vara flytande i både svenska och engelska, i såväl tal som skrift.

### **Vem är du?**


Vi ser gärna att du har ett starkt användarfokus och genuint intresse för att förstå och förbättra användarupplevelser. Du är analytisk och lösningsorienterad, och drivs av att skapa tydliga, intuitiva designlösningar som möter både användarnas behov och verksamhetens mål. Samtidigt är du en trygg och tydlig kommunikatör som kan presentera och motivera dina designval på ett övertygande sätt för olika målgrupper. Du trivs i samarbete och har lätt för att bygga relationer med kollegor och intressenter. Eftersom arbetet sker i en agil och föränderlig miljö är du flexibel och anpassningsbar, samtidigt som du är självgående och strukturerad i ditt arbetssätt.

### **Välkommen med din ansökan**

  

Anställningens omfattning: 100%  

Anställningsform: Tidsbegränsad anställning som konsult via JobBusters.


Arbetsmodell: På plats hos kund


Lön: Enligt överenskommelse  

Start: 2025-10-01  

Slut: 2026-04-30, med möjlighet till förlängning  

Sista ansökningsdag: (om det finns en) ÅÅÅÅ-MM-DD  

Utvalda förmåner: Kollektivavtal, Friskvårdsbidrag, Benifex med mera  

I din ansökan: *säkerställ att det tydligt framgår att du är kvalificerad utefter kundens önskade kvalifikationer*

### **Bra att känna till!**


Vi går igenom ansökningarna löpande. Då processerna i konsultvärlden ofta går snabbt kan tjänsten tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum – vänta därför inte med att skicka in din ansökan!


Du behöver inte skriva ett personligt brev utan i stället ber vi dig svara på urvalsfrågorna i samband med ansökan.

### **Företagspresentation**


Vår kund är ett svenskt multinationellt företag som tillverkar maskindrivna utomhusprodukter. De har en stark passion för innovation och miljöomsorg.

title: Design UI/UX
description:
**Sammanfattning:**


Vi söker en UX-designer för att stödja den fortsatta utvecklingen av vår portal, som betjänar användare inom alla våra tre divisioner. Denna roll fokuserar på att leverera högkvalitativa användarupplevelser genom användarundersökningar och datadriven design. Du kommer att arbeta praktiskt med UX-flöden och användarinsikter och bidra till både strategiskt och dagligt designarbete. Ett nära samarbete med UX-ledaren, andra designers och produktteamet är avgörande för att säkerställa att användarnas behov uppfylls och att designlösningarna överensstämmer med affärsmålen. Rollen inkluderar även att hantera intressenternas förväntningar.

**Placering:**


Stockholm eller Göteborg

**Uppgifter:**

* Samarbeta nära med projektledaren, UX-ledaren och UX/UI-designers för att forma och genomföra användarupplevelsen för portalen.
* Ta ansvar för UX-uppgifter inom pågående initiativ och funktionsutveckling.
* Genomför användarundersökningar, intervjuer och användbarhetstester för att samla in handlingsbara insikter.
* Analysera användarbeteende, problemområden och feedback för att informera designförbättringar.
* Skapa användarflöden med hjälp av det befintliga Husqvarna-designsystemet i Figma.
* Säkerställ överensstämmelse med designsystemet och tillgänglighetsstandarder.
* Översätt affärs- och användarbehov till intuitiva, tillgängliga designlösningar.
* Kommunicera designrationaler och hantera intressenternas förväntningar med självförtroende.
* Arbeta med utvecklare för att överlämna design och stödja implementeringen.
* Facilitera workshops, delta i designgranskningar och sprintplanering.
* Följ upp viktiga användarmål och KPI:er för att mäta och iterera design baserat på feedback, data och utvecklande krav.
* Dokumentera UX-beslut i Confluence och underhåll designartefakter för teamanpassning.

**Nödvändiga färdigheter:**

* Nödvändig UX/UI-erfarenhet och färdigheter för att slutföra uppgifter.

title: eCom Analytics & Insights Manager
description:
Marshall Group is the audio, tech, and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking innovation. Our flagship brand, Marshall, is uniquely positioned with over 60 years of rock ‘n’ roll attitude on stage, at home, and on the go. Our iconic products are brought to life by a dedicated team of 800 passionate employees and sold in over 90 markets worldwide.

 **What you’ll do:**


As an eCom Analytics & Insights Manager in the Global eCom Experience team, you will work hands-on to transform data into actionable insights that shape our eCom strategy and performance. In this role you will support in making sure we have the right tracking and reports to be able to uncover opportunities and evaluate campaigns as well as reporting on the correct KPIs. You are on top of customers' behavior across site and CRM, notice trend shifts when they happen and are well experiences within CRO and A/B testing. Great communication and interpersonal skills will make you successful in this role. You are reporting to Senior Manager, eCom Experience.

**Roles & Responsibilities:**

* Monitoring the sites and CRM on a daily basis to follow-up on KPIs on both a global and regional level and product category level.
* Continuously monitoring user behaviors and sharing insights with the UX/UI Designer
* Setting plans for CRO and A/B testing and support with evaluations and sharing these with stakeholders
* Creating monthly reports, campaign reports, project evaluations and supporting with quarterly business reviews to follow-up on KPIs
* Managing our eCom Dashboard, report templates, documentations and structures for reporting
* Analyzing and reporting on our CRM data base and helping define segments
* Mentoring the team on how to analyze and follow-up within their area of responsibilities
* Setting up tracking of events in GTM

 **You probably have the following experiences & skills:**

* 5+ years experience of similar roles
* Experience in GA4, Looker, Funnel.io, Qlik Sense, PowerBI or similar tools
* Understanding of BigQuery and basic SQL
* Experience analyzing multi-market e-commerce
* Experience of technical implementation of tracking of events and GTM
* Experience with CRO and A/B testing across site and CRM
* Great at creating presentations with clear takeaways and graphs to paint the picture
* Experience from working hands-on with digital/performance marketing and SEO is a plus

 **Our pledge:**


We thrive to foster an inclusive workplace and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, leading to better experiences for our consumers. We encourage applications from all over the world. To enable transitioning from another country for a role at Marshall, we offer re-location support. This support is tailored for each role but always includes visa/work permit application, local authority registration, and home finding service. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.

**Does this sound like you?**


We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Product Manager
description:
Pigellos tillväxtresa fortsätter, och vi söker nu en nyckelperson till vårt produktteam – en Product Manager som vill vara med och utveckla nästa generations fastighetsförvaltningssystem. I den här rollen får du helhetsansvar för en eller flera domäner inom vår plattform, exempelvis boendeportaler, ärendehantering, kommunikation, avtal eller energioptimering – beroende på din profil och bakgrund.


Du kommer att arbeta tvärfunktionellt tillsammans med utvecklare, UX-designers, affärsteam och kunder för att säkerställa att våra lösningar skapar verkligt värde och är både användarvänliga och tekniskt genomförbara.


Vi söker dig som gillar att omsätta användarbehov till produktstrategi, som drivs av att skapa struktur i komplexa utmaningar – och som vill se tydliga resultat av sitt arbete.

**Vem är du?**


Vi tror att du är en strukturerad och kommunikativ person med flera års erfarenhet av produktledning, gärna inom tech- eller SaaS-bolag. Du har en god förståelse för digital produktutveckling, UX och agila arbetssätt och är van vid att samarbeta med både utvecklingsteam och kunder. Har du dessutom erfarenhet från PropTech eller fastighetsbranschen är det ett stort plus, men inget krav.

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter och ansvar:**

* Driva produktstrategi och roadmap för din del av plattformen
* Identifiera användarbehov genom kundintervjuer, dataanalys och samarbete med affären
* Definiera och prioritera funktionalitet i samarbete med utvecklingsteamet
* Leda discovery- och designarbete för nya lösningar
* Säkerställa kvalitet, användarvänlighet och teknisk genomförbarhet
* Följa upp produkternas resultat genom KPI:er, feedback och användardata
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om branschtrender och konkurrentlandskapet

**För att lyckas i denna roll behöver du:**

* Flera års erfarenhet av produktledning inom tech eller SaaS
* God förståelse för UX, digital produktutveckling och agil metodik
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta nära både utvecklingsteam och kunder
* Förmåga att omvandla komplexa problem till tydliga och genomförbara lösningar
* Strukturerad, kommunikativ och initiativrik
* Erfarenhet från PropTech, fastighetsförvaltning eller relaterade branscher är meriterande, men inget krav

**Om tjänsten**

* Tillträde: Snarast eller enligt överenskommelse
* Arbetstid: Heltid
* Arbetsort: Stockholm
* Sista ansökningsdatum: Urval och intervjuer sker löpande

**Om Pigello**


Pigello är ett snabbt växande PropTech-bolag som utvecklar nästa generations fastighetsförvaltningssystem. Vårt mål är att förenkla och digitalisera vardagen för fastighetsägare, förvaltare och boende genom smart teknik och användarvänliga lösningar. Vi kombinerar djup branschförståelse med ett modernt SaaS-tänk för att bygga produkter som verkligen gör skillnad.

**Vad erbjuder vi?**

* Möjlighet att påverka en produkt med stor samhällsnytta
* Entreprenöriell miljö med snabba beslutsvägar
* Ett kompetent och engagerat team som brinner för teknik och kundvärde
* Flexibilitet och möjlighet till hybridarbete
* Konkurrenskraftiga villkor och möjlighet att växa med bolaget

**Vill du vara en del av vår resa?**


Känner du igen dig I beskrivningen ovan? Då vill vi mycket gärna komma i kontakt med dig! Ansök direkt via denna annons eller skicka ditt CV och personliga brev till talent@pigello.se.

title: Senior Android Engineer
description:
Svea Solar is on the verge of transforming how we manage energy with just the click of a button. We're here to help our customers make the most of their energy usage while also balancing the energy grid with smart, innovative solutions. To bring this vision to life, we're expanding our app team and are on the lookout for our a **Senior Android Engineer**.


### **The Role**


As our Senior Android Engineer you will be working with our new, customer facing Android App. The app helps our customers to optimize their energy consumption, as well as contribute to a more sustainable world!


You will be working closely with our Product Manager, Android Staff Engineer and the rest of the app team consisting of our designers and our engineers specialized in iOS, Android and Backend development. You will collaborate with the team to define and implement solutions from our roadmap. Discover more about the team by listening to this interview.  

  



**About the Android app:**

* New app built with Kotlin and Jetpack Compose.
* Interfaces with a newly built backend.
* Built using the latest and greatest frameworks from Google.
* Minimum version requirement is currently Android 10.
* 

**Responsibility:**

* Collaborate with product managers, UX/UI designers, and backend engineers to define application requirements and specifications.
* Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code following industry best practices and design patterns.
* Conduct code reviews and provide constructive feedback to ensure code quality and adherence to standards.
* Troubleshoot and resolve application issues, ensuring high performance and responsiveness.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest development trends, tools, and technologies, and evaluate their applicability to our projects.
* Mentor and guide junior developers, fostering a collaborative and knowledge-sharing environment.
* Contribute to documentation and provide insights on application architecture and design choices.

### **Are We a Match?**


To thrive at Svea Solar we think it's important that our values correlate with your own, since they are the guiding stars that help us move forward.


We’ve been building cutting-edge features for our Android app since its launch in 2022, so to be a good fit you should bring deep Kotlin expertise and a strong passion for the Android development ecosystem.


If you see yourself in the description above, we believe there’s great potential for a match. And if you also check off some (or all) of the boxes below, we think it could be an excellent fit!

* You know how to write readable, idiomatic, and maintainable Kotlin and are willing to follow already defined coding guidelines and workflows.
* You have released at least one app on the Google Play store or have a project in the works that you can tell us about.
* You value team success over personal success.
* Our organizational language is English which is a must-have.


The requirements may seem extensive, but please feel free to apply if you recognize yourself in some of them.  

  



### **What we offer?**


At Svea Solar, we promote diversity and inclusion, as different perspectives drive innovation. Here, you will have the opportunity to grow professionally and contribute to the energy solutions of the future. As part of our team, you will play an important role in "The Power Shift" towards a greener future, focusing on teamwork, growth, and a fun working environment.
  

  

**Svea Solar – More Than Just Solar Panels**  

Svea Solar is not only a leader in solar panel installations, but we also aim to be a long-term energy partner for our customers. We offer a broad product portfolio with smart solutions that enable our customers to optimize their energy usage. Our offerings include **heat pumps in collaboration with IKEA**, electric vehicle chargers, batteries, electricity contracts, and our own **energy optimization software (VPP)**. We are continuously working to develop new solutions that make a difference — both for our customers and for the climate.

**Application**

* We’ll start screening candidates during July, but interviews will begin in **mid-August and early September**.
* **On** **this page, you will find more information about our recruitment processes.**
* For the final candidate, we conduct a background check on criminal records.

  

We warmly welcome your application!

50670 Köln

title: UX Writer
description:
### **About InvestEngine**


We’re a London-based fintech on a mission to make ETF investing simple and accessible. Over 100,000 clients have trusted us with over £1.5 billion in assets — and we’re just getting started. We’ve been featured by Forbes, MoneyWeek, and Finder, and we’re growing fast with big ambitions.

#### **About the Role**


We’re looking for a UX Writer to join our Product Design team and shape how our platform communicates with users. You’ll work at the intersection of product, design, compliance, and marketing — defining voice and tone, simplifying complex flows, and crafting a cohesive content experience across the app and beyond.


This is a high-impact, standalone role with full ownership of UX writing across the platform. You’ll set content standards, contribute from the earliest design stages, and play a key role in building clarity and trust for our users.

#### **What You’ll Do**

* Define and evolve our tone of voice across product and marketing
* Create and maintain a glossary of terms and expressions
* Collaborate with Design, Compliance, Product, Marketing and Project teams throughout the process
* Craft copy for core journeys including onboarding, transfers, and pension/saving flows
* Help reduce support tickets volumes by improving in-product communication (product clarity, clarity of instructions)
* Support content across marketing channels: email, push, blog, in-app
* Contribute to our UX writing system and Brandbook guidelines
* Use language to improve clarity, conversion, and user confidence

#### **What We’re Looking For**

* 2+ years of UX writing experience focused on complex product interfaces
* Proficient level of English (C1 level and above) — we are a UK-based fintech so we stick to the British standards - grammar, spelling, and cultural nuances matter a lot
* Experience in regulated industries (is a plus or will be beneficial) — ideally fintech or financial services
* Proactive mindset — you don’t wait for instructions, you identify problems and bring solutions
* Ability to balance legal/compliance needs with clarity and usability (end-user experience)
* Strong communication and collaboration skills
* Comfortable working with Figma, familiar with components and copy tokens
* A portfolio showcasing real product and UX copy with clear rationale, strategic thinking, and examples of cross-functional collaboration throughout the content design process.

#### **Nice to Have**

* Experience with e-commerce, fintech/finance/financial services, classifieds?, or other complex domains
* Experience with content automation or localisation tools
* Background in marketing or copy writing
  

#### **How We Work**


We’re a lean, fast-moving team that values clarity, initiative, and ownership. UX Writers are embedded in product teams — not an afterthought. We aim to build products that people trust.

### **What We Offer**

* **Impact from day one**  

You’ll shape how thousands of people interact with our product. From tone of voice to user flows — your impact will make a noticeable difference.
* **Real contribution and growth**  

We're building something meaningful, and you’ll have the chance to grow with it. Your work won’t be a layer — it will be core to how we deliver value.
* **Competitive salary**  

We offer a competitive salary paid in GBP. We conduct regular performance reviews and reward outstanding contributions.
* **Supportive team of experts**  

Work alongside experienced and collaborative teammates with profound fintech expertise — all committed to doing great work, together.
* **Flexible setup**  

Work remotely. Choose the schedule and environment that helps you do your best work. We care about outcomes, not where you sit.

#### **Our Hiring Process**

* Intro call with Talent team
* Portfolio review and async or live writing task
* Technical Interview with Design team
* Final сall with the Leadership team
  


Straightforward and quick — 1–2 weeks in total.

title: UX/UI Designer with Frontend Development Skills
description:
At Evolution AB / Nolimit City, we create world-class gaming products with bold, uncompromising design and unmatched attention to detail. We're looking for a UX/UI Designer who doesn't just stop at the design phase — you also bring your ideas to life in code.
 



  





 You'll join a cross-functional product team with full ownership over the solutions you design, working on innovative and highly interactive user experiences seen by players around the world. You’ll collaborate closely with engineers to bring your ideas to life—creating products that are both beautiful and usable. Depending on your experience, you might implement parts of the frontend yourself or work alongside developers to ensure your vision is realized in the final product.
 



  





**What You'll Do** 



* Lead UX and UI design efforts for new and existing products — from user flows and wireframes to high-fidelity mockups.
* Translate your designs into functional, responsive, and accessible frontend components using React (Next.js) and TypeScript.
* Partner with developers and stakeholders to iterate on solutions, run experiments, and refine interfaces based on user feedback and performance data.
* Build and maintain components in a shared design system, ensuring consistency and scalability across products.
* Advocate for user-centered design throughout the product development process.



  





**You Might Be a Great Fit If You** 



* Have a strong background in UX/UI design, with a portfolio showcasing thoughtful, elegant interfaces and interaction design.
* Are fluent in modern design tools like Figma, and enjoy prototyping and testing user flows.
* Know how to write clean, maintainable frontend code using React and TypeScript.
* Are comfortable working with developers and understand how design decisions impact performance and implementation.
* Care deeply about usability, accessibility, and the overall user experience.
* Enjoy working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where experimentation is encouraged.



  





**Bonus Points** 



* Experience with Next.js, Redux Toolkit, or Headless CMSs like Strapi.
* Familiarity with A/B testing, analytics, and data-driven design decisions.
* An understanding of game or entertainment product design patterns.



  





**Technologies You'll Touch** 



* Figma (or other tools you prefer) / Design Systems
* React / Next.js
* TypeScript / JavaScript
* Redux Toolkit
* CSS / Tailwind CSS
* Strapi (Headless CMS)
* Git (GitHub Actions)



  





**Who we are** 




 You don't need to know everything from day one. If you're a designer who loves to get your hands dirty in code, and you're passionate about crafting exceptional user experiences, we'd love to meet you.
 



  





 Join one of Sweden's fastest-growing companies and help shape the future of interactive entertainment.
 



  





 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
 



 Apply on LinkedIn, or send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
 



 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: eCommerce Internship
description:
Job ad title: eCommerce Internship
   

  

**About The Company**
*Tiger of Sweden is a Stockholm-based fashion house established in 1903 with a heritage in tailoring. For more than a century Tiger of Sweden has stood for style with purpose, dressing men and women for whom true style is about the confidence to be themselves.*
**POSITION OVERVIEW:**
 This is an unpaid internship open to students only, offering a
 **full-time but flexible** 
 work schedule. You can work from the office and/or remotely. We understand you have classes, and we'll work around your schedule.
   

  

**What You'll Learn:**
* E-commerce Fundamentals: Gain a deep understanding of e-commerce operations, including trade, data analysis, and product management.
* Interconnected Functions: See how different departments like product management, website optimization, and trade work together to drive sales and improve user experience.
* Trade Focus: Learn the impact of trade strategies on e-commerce performance, sales, and customer engagement.
* Product Management: Discover how products are built, maintained, and displayed using a Product Information Management (PIM) system.
* SEO: Learn the fundamentals for search engine optimization.
* CRM: Gain experience in CRM management by working with tasks such as creating email newsletters, setting up automations by using customer segmentations.


**TASKS & RESPONSIBILITIES:**
* Content & Product Optimization: Use synonyms, hypernyms, and Search Driven Redirects to enhance product listings and search functionality.
* SEO: Create and refine SEO content for the site, including the development of long-form content to boost visibility.
* Product Enrichment: Support the creation of product information for upcoming collection launches in our PIM tool.
* Voyado: Use data insights to craft a more personalized and engaging shopping experience, keeping customers connected to our brand and products.
* Visual Merchandising: Understand how product presentation influences customer decisions and sales.
* Learn from the Best: Collaborate with different departments and gain exposure to various e-commerce strategies and tools.


**SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS:** 
 Outline the qualifications, skills, experience, and attributes needed for the role. As above try to start with the most required skill and organize the others below. Highlight the ideal qualifications, work experience and skills. Please ensure sentences are short as per examples below.
   

  

* Strong interest in fashion and e-commerce.
* Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills.
* Meticulous and organized.
* A passion for learning and a willingness to take initiative.
* Fluency in English.
* Swedish, French, German or Danish is beneficial.
* Proficiency in Salesforce and Inriver is beneficial but not required.


**Other**
* Currently enrolled as a student
* Start date: From August/September 2025. Minimum 3 months (min 15 h/week)


 This internship offers a unique opportunity to gain valuable hands-on experience in a fast-paced e-commerce environment. You'll work alongside a passionate team, learn from industry experts, and contribute to the success of a leading fashion brand.
   

  

 The position is based in
 *our Head office in Stockhol* 
 m and is an unpaid full-time position.
 *If this sounds like the perfect fit* 
 for you? Please don't hesitate to apply by submitting a CV and personal letter in English.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application.
   

  

 Tiger of Sweden stands against any form of discrimination and strives to be an inclusive brand and workplace. We welcome applications from all individuals, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, race, or disability and recruitment is purely on the based-on skills and experience.

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
**About Us**
 At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Bird & Bird, Pérez-Llorca, and Mannheimer Swartling. Backed by over $100M in funding from top investors including Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, and top tier law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 We’re hiring a Senior Product Designer to shape the core experience of the most intuitive legal platform in the world. You’ll work end-to-end—exploring ideas, crafting clear interfaces, and refining details in close collaboration with engineers. The role is execution-first: your strength lies in turning complex workflows into simple, powerful interfaces, especially as we design new patterns for working with AI.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Design user flows, interactions, and interfaces for AI-powered tools
* Turn ambiguous problems into concrete, high-quality product experiences
* Work hands-on with engineers to bring your designs to life
* Use Figma to design, document, and iterate with speed
* Contribute to—and help scale—our design system
* Push for clarity, consistency, and quality in every corner of the product


 Who you are
   

  

* Strong experience designing digital products end-to-end
* A portfolio that shows clear thinking, elegant UI, and shipped product work
* Sharp visual skills and attention to detail
* Curiosity about how AI changes user behavior and interfaces
* Pragmatism and a bias toward shipping over theorizing


 What's in it for you
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


**We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve.**
 We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Digital Workplace Transformation Leader - Sweden
description:
**Job Description**
**Role** 
 – Industry Principal /Digital Workplace Transformation Leader
   

  

**Skill** 
 - Digital Workplace Transformation
   

  

**Location** 
 – Sweden
   

  

**Compensation** 
 – Competitive (including bonus)
   

  

**Job Description**
 The Digital Workplace Advisory Group is a strategic practice unit established to help orchestrate the breadth of Infosys digital workplace service offerings across the technology service-lines, complemented with experience design, digital adoption & learning services to deliver an integrated and human-centric experience to our enterprise clients in their journey to the future of work. This team is responsible for driving integrated Go To Market incubating industry solutions, Managing Analyst Briefings & provide technology advisory services to Client execs in their digital transformation of workplace.
   

  

**Your role**
 In the role of Industry Principal, you would be part of team of digital workplace transformation leaders and evangelists on future of work who specialize in leading organizations through digital workplace transformation by leveraging emerging workplace technologies. You will work on customer engagements to define, sell and guide customers on initiatives in the areas of digital workplace strategy, employee experience transformation, workplace modernization, organizational change and smart workspace design.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
* Provide technology advisory services to Client Executives on their digital workplace strategy & roadmap.
* Lead large digital workplace transformation programs as a trusted Technology advisor to clients working with multiple client stakeholders, business groups and service providers.
* Provide best-fit architectural solutions, technology consultation, assist in defining scope and sizing of work, create technology differentiation to ensure high quality technical solutions and thought leadership for digital workplace.
* Manage a range of stakeholders and subject matter experts to ensure alignment to business needs.
* Liase with various integration forums and internal governance committees
* Strategic and Large deal advisory – Lead integrated solutions for large proposals or client programs (digital workplace).
* Program manage large consulting/advisory engagements for digital workplace.


**Required - Mandatory:**
* Experience in IT .
* A Digital Workplace Technology strategist and evangelist who specializes in leading organizations through digital transformation by leveraging emerging technology and articulating the strategy to deliver new products, business paradigms and ecosystem partnerships that enable growth and increase operational efficiency.
* Well versed with Industry Standards, OEM Standards, and Service Offerings in the “Digital Workplace” domain to be able to provide solution advisory and transformation strategy.
* Experience across the breadth of Digital Workplace Technology domains in Three or more of the below service offering domains –


 Employee Experience, Modern Workplace and Endpoint Management, Digital Collaboration (Team Collaboration , Cloud Voice & Meeting & Collaborative Apps ), DaaS & Device lifecycle Management (Modern device and endpoint management, Cloud Virtual Desktops, Device Analytics & experience management ), Connected Workspaces ( IoT, AR/VR ), Workplace Security), Digital Adoption & Change Management ( incl. Workplace Analytics), Service desk & experience, ( incl. Conversational AI & Automation).
   

  

**Personal**
 Besides the professional qualifications of the candidates, we place great importance in addition to various forms personality profile. These include:
   

  

* Excellent in Verbal, written communication.
* Strong stakeholder management and negotiation skills to be able to influence or manage difficult stakeholders both internal and external – partners, service providers and customers.
* Willingness and flexibility to learn new technologies (learnability, having a pulse on industry trends), scale up quickly and adapt to different roles as the situation demands.


**Why Infosys**
 Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 56 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.
   

  

 Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys (NYSE: INFY) can help your enterprise navigate your next.

title: Visual and Motion Designer
description:
Established in 2004,
 **OLIVER** 
 is the world’s first and only specialist in designing, building, and running bespoke in-house agencies and marketing ecosystems for brands. We partner with over 300 clients in 40+ countries and counting. Our unique model drives creativity and efficiency, allowing us to deliver tailored solutions that resonate deeply with audiences.
   

  

 As a part of
 **The Brandtech Group** 
 , we're at the forefront of leveraging cutting-edge AI technology to revolutionise how we create and deliver work. Our
 **AI solutions** 
 enhance efficiency, spark creativity, and drive insightful decision-making, empowering our teams to produce innovative and impactful results.
   

  

**Role:** 
 Visual and Motion Designer
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**About the role:**
 Working in partnership with our client, a renowned global leader in the drinks and beverages industry to recruit a talented Visual and Motion Designer. This role involves taking digital, print, and social content projects from concept to completion.
   

  

 You'll infuse fresh ideas, spark consumer interest through compelling creativity, and adhere to brand guidelines, managing projects within time and budget constraints. Collaborate with a multi-disciplinary dynamic team of 15 creative professionals, including Art Directors, designers, copywriters, project managers, UX designers, developers, and product managers, to shape and elevate our brand's visual identity. Reporting directly to the Creative Director, you'll be a key player in driving design excellence and innovation.
   

  

**What you will be doing:**
* Concept, idea development and visual design.
* Graphic design development including artwork, mock-ups, presentations, motion design/graphics.
* Social Media asset production.
* Monitor industry trends and research developments in branding and marketing.
* Produce designs/ideas to the client's brief and exacting standards from start to completion.
* Direct, oversee and execute production of content and concepts for digital platforms.
* Ensure all content is highest quality and relevant for multiple markets.
* Direct development of post imagery and copy, including guiding team members.
* Work proactively to push brands toward new creative expressions.
* Ensure all concepts follow responsible communication guidelines.
* Develop effective working relationships with colleagues and clients.


**What you need to be great in this role:** 
  

  

* Motion Design and Animation:
+ Strong skills in 2D motion design and animation.
+ Keen eye for timing, rhythm, and visual storytelling.
+ Proficiency in After Effects and Premiere.
+ Ability to storyboard animation concepts.
+ Experience creating engaging motion graphics for various platforms.

* Video Editing:
+ Proficient in editing video content for multiple platforms.
+ Skill in ensuring narrative flow and brand consistency.
+ Up-to-date knowledge of current editing trends, techniques, and emerging tools.
+ Experience in post-production and FX.
+ Ability to adapt content for different digital formats and channels.

* Design:
+ Solid foundation in graphic design, including typography, layout, and composition.
+ Ability to support and interpret art direction across motion and static assets.
+ Comfortable contributing to visual concept development.
+ Strong collaboration skills with senior creatives.
+ Experience creating cohesive design systems across multiple touchpoints.

* Excellent client engagement skills with the ability to proactively organise and influence clients and build strong and effective working relationships
* An innate creative flair, interested in art direction and in developing concepting skills
* Strong knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite including Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign.
* Strong typography, layout and technical skills with excellent attention to detail
* An understanding how to work across online banners (static and animated), social media posts (primarily Instagram and Facebook), web design, UI design, HTML email and storytelling
* An understanding of responsive design across all digital platforms
* An understanding of UX and latest Social and Digital technology trends
* Motion and video skills using After Effects, Premiere and Storyboarding Animation concepts
* Working on print-based collateral with great knowledge of branding
* The ability to talk through your ideas confidently with the team and clients
* Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office and a keen interest in emerging technologies such as AI enhance project deliveries.
* Experience in consumer goods, luxury, or drinks and beverages sectors preferred.
* 8 + years of relevant experience in:
+ Digital
+ Motion Graphics
+ Web Design
+ Artwork
+ Production


 Req ID: 13239
   

  

 Our values shape everything we do:
   

  

 Be
 **Ambitious** 
 to succeed
   

  

 Be
 **Imaginative** 
 to push the boundaries of what’s possible
   

  

 Be
 **Inspirational** 
 to do groundbreaking work
   

  

 Be
 **always learning and listening** 
 to understand
   

  

 Be
 **Results-focused** 
 to exceed expectations
   

  

 Be
 **actively pro-inclusive and anti-racist** 
 across our community, clients and creations
   

  

*OLIVER,* 
*a part of the Brandtech Group, is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all employees are encouraged to reach their full potential, and individual differences are valued and respected. All applicants shall be considered for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, neurodivergence, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by local laws.*
*OLIVER has set ambitious environmental goals around sustainability, with science-based emissions reduction targets. Collectively, we work towards our mission, embedding sustainability into every department and through every stage of the project lifecycle.*

title: Product Manager
description:
Are you passionate about digital product development and eager to make a real impact?
   

  

 At If, we call it a Senior Digital Business Developer, but what we’re really looking for is an experienced digital product leader with a strong mix of Product Manager and Product Owner skills. Someone who is excited about shaping digital services today – and reimagining what they could become tomorrow. Someone who is as driven by delivering real customer value as they are by exploring future trends.
   

  

 This is your opportunity to be at the forefront of digital transformation in claims – in a role that blends strategic direction, hands-on execution, and a keen eye for innovation.
   

  

**About The Position**
 In this role, you’ll be responsible for the overall product management of the Claims Intake area – where customers, partners, and connected devices meet report their claims.
   

  

 With a Nordic scope, working across all segments, you will be responsible for driving increased utilization and great customer experiences for more than half of the roughly 2,5 million claims each year. The intake area includes both customer-facing interfaces and sophisticated internal platforms, and the role requires someone who can master the high-level roadmap while ensuring continuous development and operations.
   

  

 We’re looking for someone who thrives in fast-moving, international environments, sees opportunities in complexity, and is naturally curious about emerging technologies like AI, automation and connected services – and how they can improve real-world customer experiences.
   

  

**We Offer**
 In the same way that we place high demands on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer.
   

  

 Here are some of the benefits of working at If:
   

  

* An including work environment where everyone is welcome
* Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
* Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
* Possibility of hybrid workplace
* Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
* Great insurance benefits


**Your tasks and responsibilities will include:**
* Developing a deep understanding of the intake domain – across customer needs, data, systems and business logic
* Establishing and driving the vision, strategy and roadmap for digital intake capabilities
* Ensuring development efforts are aligned with strategic ambitions and operational excellence
* Identifying and driving opportunities to improve the customer journey, including automation and self-service
* Collaborating closely with squads, developers, designers, architects and business stakeholders
* Continuously evaluating performance and product metrics to guide decisions and prioritization
* Facilitating experimentation and discovery of new value-creating features and ideas – especially within AI integration
* Supporting the evolution of our digital platforms by balancing innovation, scalability and stability
* Translating customer needs and business goals into actionable plans for development
* Enabling cross-platform collaboration and ensuring a cohesive user experience across digital channels
* Collaborating with external and internal partners on API integrations and other technical enablers


**About the team** 
 You will be part of the Digital Development unit in Claims , responsible for meeting digital expectations across all Nordic markets and customer segments. Our agile mindset ensures efficient and effective value delivery. You’ll work closely with your squad and share experiences with colleagues across the Nordic region.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 You are a driven, hands-on digital product professional who takes ownership and delivers results. You’re passionate about building services that genuinely help people and motivated by the idea of simplifying complexity – for both users and internal teams.
   

  

 You understand that great digital experiences require both strategy and structure, and you have the mindset to connect business goals with technical capabilities. You're also the kind of person who follows tech developments – not because you have to, but because you’re genuinely curious.
   

  

**You also have:**
*Strategy*
* 5+ years of experience in digital product management or development roles
* A proven track record of contributing to or leading multi-faceted digital products
* Experience working across the full product lifecycle – from concept to operations
* Strong understanding of digital service and software design principles
* Comfortable creating and presenting strategy, progress, and recommendations to management
* Solid analytical, critical thinking and decision-making skills
* Excellent communication and storytelling skills – fluency in English is a must
* Structured and proactive – you know how to prioritize and move things forward
* Passionate about solving problems and making things better


*Behavior*
* Curious and eager to learn – especially from colleagues, users, and technology
* A team player who leads through inspiration and collaboration
* Experience in guiding teams toward a shared vision in agile, cross-functional setups


*Keep an eye on the future*
* Actively following AI trends, digital developments and emerging technologies
* Inspired by how new tools can enhance customer experience, efficiency, and business growth


**Sound Like You?**
 We’re not looking for someone to maintain the status quo – we’re looking for someone who’s excited by change, growth, and new ideas. If you're ready to drive digital product development with impact, and you're energized by AI, automation, and future-facing technology, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

**Additional facts** 
 :
   

  

**Application deadline:** 
 Screening and interviewing will start in August. However, application deadline is August 17, 2025.
   

**To apply for the position:** 
 Please attach your CV.
   

**Work location:** 
 Sweden, Norway or Denmark
   

**Travelling:** 
 Several times a year in the Nordic countries is required.
   

  

**Start:** 
 As soon as possible/by agreement.
   

  

 For more information, please contact us, preferbly via email or sms:
   

  

 Maja Præstbrogaard, maja.praestbrogaard@if.dk +4540448430 (Denmark & Norway)
   

  

 Hanna Lindahl hanna.lindahl@if.se +46761397518 (Sweden)
   

  

**About Us**
  

***We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.**
 To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.
   

  

 We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.
   

  

 Come and join us!*

title: AI Engineer
description:
AI Engineer – GPT Search for Ecommerce
 



  





 I'm working with one of Stockholm's most exciting and foreward thinking startups, a talented group of engineers & product-people who are looking for a cracked AI/ML engineer to join them as they transform the ecommerce space!
 



  





 We're building a groundbreaking GPT-powered search experience that transforms traditional ecommerce search bars into intuitive, conversational interfaces. As a senior engineer, you’ll be at the core of this AI-native product, combining semantic search, RAG pipelines, and personalization to redefine how people discover products online.
 



  





 🔧 What You’ll Do
 



  




* Lead the development of a conversational search product powered by cutting-edge LLM technology.
* Design, build, and optimize RAG pipelines, semantic retrieval systems, reranking models, and hyper-personalized search features.
* Move fast: prototype rapidly, iterate based on real-world shopper and merchant feedback, and deploy to production.
* Own the end-to-end ML lifecycle—from prompt engineering and model fine-tuning to evaluation and latency tuning.
* Evaluate model architectures and APIs to balance performance, cost-efficiency, and user delight.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with product, engineering, and leadership to craft a unified user experience.
* Help scale a multi-tenant AI foundation across diverse brand needs with a mix of automation and customization.
* Shape our engineering culture around experimentation, learning, and speed.



  





 🙌 Who You Are
 


* You think like a founder—scrappy, hands-on, and comfortable navigating ambiguity.
* You’re energized by LLMs, vector databases, semantic search, and real-world AI applications.
* You’ve built or contributed to production-grade ML systems—especially in ranking, retrieval, or inference-heavy domains.
* You thrive in high-velocity environments where priorities evolve and builders lead the way.
* You value impact over process and aren't afraid to hack something together to validate quickly.
* Bonus if you’ve worked with ecommerce search, vector DBs (FAISS, Weaviate), LangChain, OpenAI APIs, or similar tools.



  





 💼 What’s In It For You
 


* Be a
 **founding engineer** 
 of a high-impact product in a new AI category.
* High ownership, full autonomy, and real influence on product direction.
* Competitive compensation
* Hybrid work - Stockholm HQ but with a very flexible model
* 30 days paid vacation + wellness and learning budgets..
* Monthly co-working and quarterly off-site retreats.



  





 This is a permanent role - Visa sponsorship is currently not supported.
 



  





 Want to help reinvent how people shop online—powered by AI? This is your moment.

title: Lead Product Manager
description:
**About Us**
 At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Bird & Bird, Pérez-Llorca, and Mannheimer Swartling. Backed by over $80M in funding from top investors including Benchmark, ICONIQ, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, and top tier law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 We’re hiring multiple
 **Lead Product Managers** 
 across a range of teams—including Core Product, AI focused, Integrations and more. This is a high-impact opportunity to shape foundational parts of our product and deliver powerful experiences that transform the way legal work gets done.
   

  

 We are seeking experienced and passionate Lead Product Managers to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will lead a dedicated product area, taking full ownership of end-to-end workflows, and contribute to scaling our core infrastructure. We are looking for individuals who are energized by tackling complex challenges, thrive in a collaborative cross-functional environment, and are comfortable moving quickly in a culture of continuous learning and innovation. Your expertise will be crucial in driving product strategy, defining roadmaps, and ensuring successful execution to deliver impactful solutions.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Lead the full product lifecycle for your area—from discovery to launch and iteration
* Define strategy, roadmap, and priorities in collaboration with your team and company leadership
* Turn complex user needs, technical inputs, and business goals into clear, actionable product requirements
* Work closely with engineering, AI, design, and go-to-market teams to build and ship world-class solutions
* Balance usability, scalability, and compliance in fast-changing contexts
* Track product performance through qualitative and quantitative signals—and iterate rapidly
* Help shape our product culture with a focus on user empathy, craftsmanship, and results
* Stay on top of AI, product, and legal tech trends that can inform our work


 Who you are
   

  

* You have several as a Product Manager, ideally in a high-growth or technical environment
* You’ve shipped complex products and are comfortable owning a product area end-to-end
* You have strong product sense and the ability to turn ambiguity into clarity and action
* You’re a collaborative team player who builds strong relationships with engineers, designers, and business stakeholders
* You’re analytical, curious, and driven to deliver impact
* You thrive in fast-paced environments where speed and quality go hand in hand
* You’re motivated by the chance to build tools that deeply improve how people work


 What's in it for you
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


**We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve.**
 We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Fullstack Engineer at Bemlo - Linear for healthcare scheduling (W22)
description:
**About Bemlo**
 Bemlo is a comprehensive AI-powered workforce management platform, purpose-built for healthcare and social care. At its core is automated scheduling that generates optimal rosters, meeting care demands while respecting staff preferences. We develop high quality software for an industry accustomed to enterprise slop.
   

  

 Backed by top-tier investors from Silicon Valley, Bemlo has quickly established a strong presence in Sweden’s public sector. Today, we serve 8 of Sweden’s regions and a rapidly growing number of municipalities. The deals are big and we are currently
 **supply limited** 
 for new implementations.
   

  

 We’re a small but passionate, smart, and fast-moving team, driven by a commitment to delivering innovative solutions and outstanding customer service.
   

  

**About The Role**
 At Bemlo, we’re revolutionizing how healthcare providers manage scheduling and staffing challenges. By leveraging the latest in generative AI, we automate large parts of our customers’ workflows, freeing up time for them to focus on quality of care and meaningful change.
   

  

 We’re now looking for a smart and passionate
 **Fullstack Engineers** 
 help us build and polish Bemlo.
   

  

 At Bemlo, you'll have
 **incredible leverage** 
 to directly improve the lives of healthcare workers. Your code will give thousands of nurses, carers, and doctors more time with patients and healthier work lives.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Design and build intuitive software that make complex scheduling workflows feel effortless for healthcare professionals.
* Obsess over user interactions, ensuring every click saves time for busy nurses and administrators.
* Transform customer feedback into delightful solutions that actually solve real workflow problems.
* Create reusable components that maintain consistency while adapting to diverse healthcare contexts.
* Work directly with customer support to understand pain points and ship improvements that users will notice and appreciate.
* Integrate AI functionality to increase user experience rather than company pitch decks.


**Who You Are**
* Experienced in Typescript, React, Node.
* Have launched a project, OSS, product, or startup before.
* Wants to design and build high quality software, not vibe-code churn-ware.
* Excited by fast-paced startup environments, not bureaucracy.
* Educational or professional background in computer science / engineering.
* Solution-oriented with a passion for deeply understanding niche problems.
* Collaborative by nature, with a passion for user-centered innovation.
* Fluency in Swedish is a big plus as our customers are usually uncomfortable with English.
* Interested/experience in optimization.


**Techstack**
* Infra: GCP, Turborepo
* Typescript
+ Backend: Postgres, Redis, Nestjs, GraphQL
+ Frontend: React, Tailwind

* Python
+ Scheduling
+ Agents


**Location**
 We believe the best ideas come when we work together. This is a full-time role based in Stockholm and we expect to see you in the office 2-5 days a week with flexibility to work remotely for longer periods every now and then.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Incredible leverage to directly improve the lives of healthcare workers. Your code will give thousands of nurses, carers, and doctors more time with patients and healthier work lives.
* Direct impact from day one - small team means your ideas ship to thousands of users quickly.
* Competitive salary and a transparent, generous stock option program.
* A chance to help shape a category-defining company.


 We’re just at the beginning of our journey to become the market-leading scheduling and workforce management platform. The opportunity to shape the use of generative AI in healthcare is wide open.

title: Industrial PhD
description:
Scania's R&D department is transforming to become part of TRATON Group R&D. TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 Are you passionate about how humans and intelligent systems can collaborate in complex R&D environments? We are now looking for an Industrial PhD candidate to explore the intersection of artificial intelligence, human factors, and data frameworks — with the aim to shape how domain experts create, understand, and trust AI-augmented systems in vehicle development. You will split your time between academic research and real-world industrial implementation, in close collaboration with experts across embedded systems, data engineering, and user-centered design.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Conduct applied research within human-centered AI, responsible data frameworks, and decision support
* Translate qualitative insights into technical requirements and scalable design patterns
* Collaborate with engineers, analysts, and product teams in a cross-functional R&D setting
* Publish scientific findings and contribute to knowledge building in both academic and industrial contexts
* Take part in the larger data and AI transformation work at TRATON R&D, influencing future ways of working


**Who You Are**
* You bring a rare combination of technical insight and human understanding, and are driven to make AI and data work for real people in complex contexts.
* You are confident leading conversations across disciplines, and are comfortable in both fieldwork settings and strategic discussions.
* You have strong communication and storytelling skills, and a natural ability to engage people in co-creation and shared understanding
* You are proactive, curious, and eager to take ownership – not just of your research, but of how it contributes to broader impact
* You have an interest in the intersection technology implementation and human factors, with a particular focus on artificial intelligence and data frameworks.
* You have a background in interdisciplinary fieldwork in industry settings and are confident in employing qualitative research methods and communicating findings to stakeholders.
* You should have an M.Sc. degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Human-Centred Technology, Interactive Media Technology, or a similar field, and hold a Bachelor's degree in Anthropology, Cognitive Science, Computer Science, or Psychology.


*We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.*
**This Is Us**
 We are a cross-functional enablement team within Scania’s R&D organization, responsible for data platforms, AI strategies, and human-centered technology development. Our mission is to empower R&D engineers to use trustworthy data and smart tools to make faster, better decisions. You’ll work closely with experts in AI, product development, and user experience design – in a context where your research can directly shape the way we build the future of transportation.
   

  

 Within TRATON Group R&D, you are an important part of something bigger. Joining us means gaining access to the ins and outs of the entire transportation industry. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Being bigger also means being stronger. Together with our brands, we have the collective power to transform transportation.
   

  

**We Offer**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include wellness allowance, TRATON result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-08-01. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

**If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:**
 Sarah Hantosi Albertsson, Head of Global Analytics Enablement, sarah.hantosi.albertsson@scania.com
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Business Analyst to Channel Development within Cash Management
job_function: Business Development, Analyst, and Information Technology
company_industry: Banking and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Our team is on a mission to deliver user friendly and efficient payment solutions to meet the needs of our corporate customers in Swedish digital channels.
   

  

 About the team:
   

  

* Team consists of software engineers with well balanced level of experience and different focuses from Front-End, Back-End development to testing (manual, automated), Business Analysts with high focus on quality and outcome of deliveries
* Team is spread across two locations, Vilnius and Stockholm. So, travelling few times a year might apply
* We are a friendly and supportive team that lives Swedbank values: Open, Simple, Caring


 Role responsibilities:
   

  

 Main responsibility of the Business Analyst is to gather requirements, analyse and document it in a structured way, refine together with development team to secure it is understood by all team members and ensure quality of the delivery
   

  

* You will collaborate with Product Owners, Product Specialists and other Stakeholders and gather requirements in order to understand the needs and objectives of the delivery
* You will conduct workshops, interviews and meetings to gather detail requirements and document those in Jira, Confluence etc.
* You will lead refinement meetings together with development team to secure the understanding of requirements, needs and objectives
* You will work closely with UX designers and solution architects to ensure solution meets both user needs and business objectives
* You will continuously evalute delivered solutions for any improvements or enhancements
* You will be part of maintenance and incident handling routine
* Together with the team, you will constantly strive to improve our ways of working


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* Experience in the role as Business Analyst (preferably in the banking payments domain)
* Strong analytical skills
* Excellent communication abilities
* Curiosity and attention to the details
* Capacity to balance both requirements and deliveries from a helicopter view as well as ability to deep dive into the details
* Strong sense of ownership and a drive to gain domain knowledge
* Self-driven, solution-oriented, with a positive can-do attitude and value driven mindset
* Understanding of Software Development Life Cycle


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance


 " Join our team and...
   

  

 be a part of an international team of professionals, who are jointly delivering challenging projects, maximizing customer value and increasing Swedbank’s competitive advantage."
 **Mindaugas Kniukšta – Competence Lead**
 We look forward to your application at 01.08.2025 the latest
   

  

**Contacts:** 
 Recruiting manager: Mindaugas Kniuksta, +37069840341
   

  

*If you are to be employed in Lithuania, please note that the salary offered for this position ranges from 3
 *,300–5,100 €* 
 gross i.e. before taxes. Read more here.*
****Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.****

title: Arbeta med verksamhetsutveckling av Regeringskansliets kärnprocesser
description:
**Kansliet för utveckling av kärnprocesserna, Statsrådsberedningen** 
 Vill du vara med och forma Regeringskansliets digitala arbetssätt? Har du ett stort intresse för verksamhetsdriven utveckling och erfarenhet av att arbeta med utveckling av verksamhetsprocesser, kravanalys eller liknande? Trivs du i en roll med många kontaktytor? Vi erbjuder rätt person en spännande roll i utvecklingen av Regeringskansliets kärnprocesser.
   

  

**Din arbetsdag. Sveriges morgondag.** 
 Kansliet för utveckling av kärnprocesserna driver och samordnar utvecklingen av kärnverksamhetens arbetsformer. Som ett led i utvecklingen har ett digitalt arbetssätt för regeringsärenden och beredningar införts i Regeringskansliet. Det digitala arbetssättet utvecklas löpande genom att bland annat utforma digitala stöd, förändra rutiner, riktlinjer och malltexter.
   

  

 Utvecklingsarbetet involverar många både i departementen och i Förvaltningsavdelningen. Som handläggare i kansliet är du med och driver utvecklingsarbetet framåt i enlighet med den fastställda inriktningen för utvecklingen. Fokus för ditt arbete är att säkerställa ett sammanhängande digitalt arbetssätt i både utveckling och förvaltning.
   

  

 Du representerar kärnverksamhetens behov, är bollplank i vägvalsfrågor och översätter och dokumenterar verksamhetens behov till konkretiserade lösningar. Du faciliterar dialoger om verksamhetsutveckling av Regeringskansliets kärnprocesser och bidrar i förändringsarbetet. Du tar fram användarberättelser, processkartor och flödesscheman. Du tar också fram underlag för revidering av rutiner och riktlinjer. Även framtagande av underlag till och deltagande i kommunikations- och utbildningsaktiviteter ingår i arbetet.
   

  

 En central del i arbetet är att stämma av de underlag som du tar fram och kommunicera innebörden av lösningarna och hur de möter verksamhetens behov.
   

  

 Du kommer arbeta nära kanslichefen och övriga medarbetare i kansliet för utveckling av kärnprocesserna.
   

  

 Fokus för och innehållet i arbetsuppgifterna kan komma att variera över tid.
   

  

 Läs mer om vår verksamhet på www.regeringen.se .
   

  

**Din bakgrund** 
 Vi söker dig som har akademisk examen inom relevant område, alternativt motsvarande kunskap, förvärvad på annat sätt, som arbetsgivaren bedömer som likvärdig. Utbildning inom kravanalys, processutveckling och UX-design liksom utbildning inom produktägarskap eller motsvarande är meriterande. För att lyckas i rollen behöver du ha erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med utveckling av verksamhetsprocesser och erfarenhet och vana av att dokumentera och översätta behov till tillämpbara lösningar. Du behöver också ha erfarenhet av att arbeta som verksamhetsutvecklare, kravanalytiker, UX-designer eller produktägare i projekt eller team om verksamhetsutveckling.
   

  

 Det är en fördel om du har erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med utveckling av verksamhetsprocesser med stöd av BPM-verktyg/processverktyg exempelvis Pega Infinity.
   

  

 Det är också en fördel om du har erfarenhet av att utveckla arbetssätt genom exempelvis förändrande rutiner, riktlinjer och instruktioner. Vi ser också gärna att du har erfarenhet av it-verktyg för kravhantering och visualisering av flöden och processer som t.ex. Figma, Microsoft Visio, Azure DevOps.
   

  

 Erfarenhet av arbete i offentlig förvaltning exempelvis genom att ha arbetat som handläggare med ärendehantering på myndighet eller i Regeringskansliet är meriterande, liksom insikt i att jobba i en politiskt styrd organisation.
   

  

 Du behöver ha goda kunskaper om verksamhetsutveckling genom digitalisering. Goda kunskaper om kravhantering, verksamhets- och processutveckling, förändringsledning och användarupplevelse kommer göra dig framgångsrik i rollen.
   

  

**Dina egenskaper** 
 Regeringskansliets medarbetarkriterier är helhet, utveckling, resultat. Alla som arbetar i Regeringskansliet behöver ha helhetssyn och samarbeta för verksamhetens bästa. Du förväntas bidra med ditt perspektiv och din kompetens samt vara öppen för andras. Du kommer med idéer och nya angreppssätt för att förbättra och utveckla verksamheten och din egen kompetens. Du är inriktad på resultat i ditt agerande och anpassar dig när behov och inriktning ändras.
   

  

 Som person är du nytänkande och kreativ. Du tar initiativ, sätter i gång aktiviteter och uppnår resultat. Du är analytisk och har förmåga att sätta in frågor i ett större sammanhang och se saker från ett övergripande perspektiv. Du utför ditt arbete med mycket gott omdöme och har lätt för att anpassa dig till ändrade förhållanden. Du är noggrann och lägger vikt vid att leverera med kvalité. Du är självständig samtidigt som du tycker om att arbeta med andra och du har mycket god samarbetsförmåga. Arbetet ställer också krav på mycket god pedagogisk och kommunikativ förmåga och du kan förklara komplexa problem på ett enkelt sätt.
   

  

**Övrigt** 
 Vi söker 1-2 medarbetare. Anställningen inleds med sex månaders provanställning.
   

  

 Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Befattningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas.
   

  

**Är du intresserad?** 
 Vill du veta mer om jobbet och vad vi erbjuder, kontakta Frida Kylberg under vecka 33, som är kanslichef, på 08-405 15 18. Du är också välkommen att kontakta HR-handläggare Helena Lundquist på 08-405 96 58. Fackliga kontaktpersoner är Susanne Grund för Saco och Karina Åbom Engberg för ST. Du når dem via Regeringskansliets växel, 08-405 10 00. Vi tar gärna emot samtal från dig som är intresserad av jobbet men vi tackar nej till dig som säljer annonser och rekryteringstjänster.
   

  

 Välkommen att registrera din ansökan i vårt rekryteringsverktyg
 **senast den** 
**17 augusti 2025** 
 .
   

  

 Regeringskansliets uppdrag är att stödja regeringen i dess arbete med att styra Sverige och förverkliga sin politik. Här arbetar 4 800 personer, varav 600 utomlands. Regeringskansliet välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter. Vi ser jämställdhet och mångfald som en styrka och tillgång och vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering. Statsrådsberedningen har ansvar för att leda och samordna arbetet i Regeringskansliet.

title: Design Systems Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Bird & Bird, Pérez-Llorca, and Mannheimer Swartling. Backed by over $100M in funding from top investors including Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, and top tier law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 We’re hiring a Design Systems Engineer to help us move faster without breaking quality. You’ll join the design team and build the foundations—components, tokens, and systems—that keep our UI consistent, accessible, and fast to ship. This is a hands-on role working closely with engineers, product managers, and designers in Stockholm to deliver great UX at scale.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Build and maintain our React-based component library
* Translate Figma designs into fast, reusable, accessible components
* Sync design and code using tokens, variants, and Figma’s code platform
* Automate handoff and reduce drift between Figma and production
* Standardize interaction patterns and UI architecture across the product
* Remove bottlenecks in design-to-code workflows and speed up delivery
* Work closely with designers, engineers, and product teams in our Stockholm office


 Who you are
   

  

* Strong experience with React, TypeScript, and modern frontend tooling
* Deep knowledge of design systems, tokens, and component architecture
* Familiarity with Figma’s developer tools (variables, REST API, MCP server, plugins, component properties)
* Sharp eye for detail and design precision
* You lead by building—code that simplifies, scales, and speeds up the work of everyone around you


 What's in it for you
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


**We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve.**
 We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

description:

 B2B contract
