title: Integrationsarkitekt till Accelerate at Iver
description:
Nu letar vi efter nya medarbetare som vill vara med på vår resa. Som en del av Accelerate at Iver ligger du i teknikens absoluta framkant och arbetar med spännande digitaliserings- och transformationsprojekt hos marknadsledande kunder. Vi är idag över 300 konsulter som brinner för att realisera digitala möjligheter i molnet. Tillsammans med våra kunder stänger vi gapet mellan aspiration och framgångsrik implementation. Nu söker vi en Integrationsarkitekt som vill bli en del av Accelerate at Iver och som vill vara med och bidra till bättre IT-lösningar som gör skillnad för våra kunder! Är du vår nya kollega?
  
Din roll på Accelerate at Iver? Som integrationsarkitekt hos Accelerate at Iver kommer du att bidra till att bygga robusta, moderna och långsiktiga integrationslösningar. Lösningarna byggs främst på Microsoft-teknologi utifrån hybrida moln, dvs on-prem och cloud. I din roll kommer du att kombinera Ivers paketerade tjänster med skräddarsydda kundunika lösningar som byggs av våra spetskonsulter inom integrationsområdet.
  
  

**Några exempel på arbetsuppgifter kan vara:**  

Ta fram lösningsförslag utifrån Accelerate at Ivers eller våra kunders arkitektur-principer i kombination med verksamhetsmässiga mål. Dokumentera lösningsförslagen åt utvecklare och andra projektdeltagare
  
Samarbeta i olika delar av projektfaser med kravställning, utvecklare, testare, beställare och produktägare
  
Samarbeta med andra lösningsarkitekter och it-arkitekter för att gemensamt ta fram bra och kostnadseffektiva lösningar
  
Ta fram konceptuella design-förslag som inledande initiativ
  
Identifiera och implementera kvalitetsförbättringar i befintliga lösningar, såsom skalbarhet, säkerhet, återanvändbarhet m.m.
  
Agera brygga mellan verksamhet och IT, kommunicera och argumentera för bra lösningar
  
Assistera i det löpande utvecklings- och förvaltningsarbetet kring integrationslösningar
  
Balansera kort- och långsiktiga mål i ditt arbetssätt
  
  

Vad erbjuder vi dig? Accelerate at Iver kan erbjuda dig ett utmanande och varierande jobb som konsult med stora personliga utvecklingsmöjligheter! Vi satsar hårt på kompetensutveckling och att ständigt hålla oss i teknisk framkant.
  
Hos Accelerate at Iver får du utvecklas tillsammans med duktiga och erfarna kollegor som har arbetat med C#, .Net Core och Microservices i flera stora och utmanade projekt de senaste åren. Våra kunder är nationella och globala både medel och stora bolag.
  
Vi har intressanta, långsiktiga uppdrag och team-leveranser där du kan utvecklas och arbeta nära kollegor som delar din passion för teknik.
  
Som anställd på Accelerate at Iver får du ett antal fördelar som:
  
En trygg och säker anställning
  
Individuellt anpassad utvecklings- och utbildningsplan
  
Friskvårdsbidrag
  
Hälso & sjukvårdsförsäkring
  
Pensions och försäkringsrådgivning
  
Förmånsportal
  
Timbank & volontärdag
  
Medarbetar och familjeaktiviteter i olika former
  
  

Vem söker vi? Du bör ha färdigheter inom alla eller vissa av dessa områden:
  
C#, .NET Core och .NET Framework
  
RESTful services, Microservices, Azure Logic Apps, Azure Function Apps, App Services, Azure API Apps
  
SQL Server, Azure SQL, Entity Framework, Azure Storage, Azure Data Factory
  
Azure Service Bus, Azure Event Grid, Azure API Management, Azure Active Directory
  
Microsoft Visual Studio/Visual Studio Code, Post man, Git, Azure DevOps, Gitflow, SoapUI
  
PowerShell, Bash
  
  

Du bör ha jobbat minst 3-5 år i utvecklingsteam med utveckling inom ovanstående områden.
  
Du bör ha jobbat i agila team med scrum- eller kanban som arbetssätt, och vara van vid de olika rollerna och rollfördelningen som ett sådant arbetssätt innebär. För att trivas i rollen som konsult bör du ha lätt att skapa relationer, kunna arbeta både i team och självständigt och ha stor personlig drivkraft och lösningsfokus.
  
Är du en social, flexibel och strukturerad person med stort intresse inom av arbeta med och att utvecklas inom de senaste teknologierna så tror vi du kommer passa in och trivas utmärkt hos oss!
  
För denna position krävs Svenskt medborgarskap, vi utför även bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat.
  
**Placeringsort:** Iver finns på 25 platser i Sverige & Norge. För denna roll ser vi att du utgår från ett av våra kontor i Stockholm.
  
Sök till oss! Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Accelerate at Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Du är välkommen att kontakta Jesper Carlsson på jesper.carlsson@iver.se vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
  
Välkommen till Accelerate at Iver!

company_addresses: Stockholm

title: Engineering Manager
description:
Opportunity


We are seeking an experienced and highly motivated Engineering Manager to lead a talented team of engineers. This is a pivotal role that combines strong technical leadership with a passion for people management. You will be instrumental in driving the design, implementation, and continuous improvement of existing enterprise-grade systems, fostering a culture of technical excellence and collaboration within an agile and DevSecOps environment. This role contributes both within and across product teams, working closely with Engineering, Product Owners, Designers, and other key roles within Technology Teams.

**What You'll Contribute (As a People Leader)**


As an Engineering Manager, you will:

* Lead and Inspire: Directly lead and manage a squad of highly talented and globally distributed Engineers with varying degrees of experience, with direct responsibility for delivering complex features.
* Provide Technical Vision: While directly managing individuals, this is a highly technical role where you will be expected to provide technical leadership both for your immediate team and more broadly across the organization.
* Nurture Talent: Be responsible for performance management, coaching, and mentoring team members to ensure their effectiveness, development, and the maintenance of a high-performing team.
* Drive Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work with teams across multiple sites and geographies as a collaborator and partner. You will gain respect and trust from a technical perspective with your immediate team and other teams, including development, support, solution sales, operations, and product management, demonstrating an ability to influence at all levels of the organization and across multiple domains without direct authority.
* Facilitate Technical Decisions: Drive and manage complex technical design discussions across various stakeholders to their logical closure.
* Implement Best Practices: Research, design, and implement industry best practices regarding provisioning, maintaining, and monitoring cloud/hybrid/on-prem environments.
* Influence Product Strategy: Work with product management and other teams to question, provide constructive pushback when required, and ultimately establish new requirements. Play a lead role in the prioritization, design, and implementation of features to deliver on the broader vision for our platforms.
* Strategic Planning & Reporting: Scope and author plans for complex, large features that may span across multiple teams and be delivered in multiple release cycles. Track and report project and feature status at the executive level as well as to release management.
* Backlog Management: Triage and managing both feature and defect backlogs. This includes understanding complex issues from customers and other teams, analyzing logs and diagnostic information, asking clarifying questions, and directing issues to the engineers best suited to address them.
* Embrace Service Ownership: Operate with a service ownership mindset, working in a DevOps model where the development team is responsible for all automation, versioning, quality, CI/CD, logging, monitoring, and maintenance of services being built.
* Ensure Code Quality: Oversee the writing of well-documented, highly performant, reliable, and maintainable production-grade code.
* Platform Evaluation: Evaluate the stability, compatibility, scalability, interoperability, and performance of the platform.
* Adaptability: Be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment where priorities and direction may change rapidly as customer requirements and market direction evolve.
* Thought Leadership: Demonstrate technical expertise through publications, presentations, white papers, and event participation across the organization.

**Who You Are**


You are a highly important “T-Shaped” leader, demonstrating both depth and breadth across key engineering competencies, including: Systems Design and Architecture, Software Development, Testing, DevOps, Security, Analytics, and Lifecycle Management. You successfully collaborate with experts from other subject domains. You possess a "whatever it takes" attitude, a passion for growing people and teams, a love for building elegant software, and strong opinions on what constitutes “good code” and “bad code.”

**Required Qualifications**

* Experience: 12+ years of progressive experience in engineering, with a minimum of 3 years of experience in managing a team.
* Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field.
* Technical Proficiency: Fully hands-on experience in Low-Level Design, Development, Design Patterns, event-driven architectures, distributed systems, scalability, and Microservices.
* Programming Skills: Excellent design and programming skills, primarily in backend development, focusing on enterprise server solutions using C# and the .NET platform (e.g., .NET Core, ASP.NET Core).
* Database Expertise: Strong hands-on experience with SQL and NoSQL databases such as Oracle, MySQL, and MongoDB.
* API Development: In-depth understanding of API design and implementation, including using and developing Web services/RESTful APIs using JAX-RS and JSON.
* Cloud & Container Technologies: Experience with Data stores such as MongoDB, Containers, and Cloud-native technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, Ansible, and Terraform.
* Messaging Infrastructure: Experience with any messaging infrastructure (e.g., Apache/Confluent Kafka, Kafka with Zookeeper, Artemis Active MQ, or Rabbit MQ).
* DevOps Tooling: Proficient in using source code management systems like Git and build tools like Maven and Gradle. Fluent in using CI/CD tools such as Jira, Git, GitHub, and Jenkins.
* Testing & Quality Tools: Good experience with unit test frameworks like JUnit, Mockito, and code coverage tools like SonarQube/JaCoCo.
* Agile Methodologies: Strong understanding of the fundamentals of agile methodologies and experience implementing Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Scaled Agile Framework® (SAFe®).
* Cloud Solutions: Experience working with cloud technologies (AWS/Azure/GCP) and building cloud-native solutions.
* Open Source: Experience with the use of open-source packages for common capabilities.
* Documentation: Strong documentation skills needed, with experience in Swagger and/or Markdown.


Maersk is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we embrace different styles of thinking. Maersk is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applicants without regard to race, colour, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy or parental leave, veteran status, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.

  

We are happy to support your need for any adjustments during the application and hiring process. If you need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website, apply for a position, or to perform a job, please contact us by emailing accommodationrequests@maersk.com.

title: Head of Engineering
description:
#### **About Learnster**


At Learnster, we help organizations orchestrate knowledge like a strategic capability. Our AI-powered SaaS platform is used in over 30 countries and trusted by ambitious companies to drive growth, performance, and adaptability through smarter learning. With a bold vision, a fast-scaling business, and a top-ranked product – we are now transforming our R&D leadership to match the next stage of our journey.


As part of this transformation, we are hiring a *Head of Engineering* to lead our technical execution, delivery capabilities, and engineering organization – with AI as a foundational enabler.

#### **Your Mission**


As Head of Engineering, your mission is to build and lead a world-class engineering team that transforms product vision into robust, scalable, and intelligent software. You’ll be responsible for Learnster’s end-to-end technical execution – from architecture and tooling to process, people, and AI-powered product delivery.


You’ll work in close partnership with the CEO and incoming CPO to shape the engineering strategy and culture, ensuring Learnster delivers with speed, stability, and innovation – across both our core platform and next-generation AI initiatives.


You’ll lead by example, not only as a senior engineering leader but as a true *Entreprenerd* – combining visionary thinking with hands-on execution, speed with structure, and continuous improvement with long-term scalability.

#### **What You’ll Do**

* Own the technical strategy and architecture across Learnster’s products.
* Lead the engineering team and its leaders – frontend, backend, QA, and DevOps.
* Drive modern development practices across coding, testing, release, and monitoring.
* Embed AI capabilities into Learnster’s core platform and product strategy.
* Evaluate and integrate technologies such as RAG pipelines, LangChain, and vector databases.
* Build the infrastructure for AI-powered product modules and ML workflows.
* Establish a secure, scalable, and performant cloud-native architecture.
* Build a culture of ownership, quality, and continuous improvement.
* Collaborate closely with Product and Design to ensure delivery is aligned, predictable, and impactful.
* Support recruitment, retention, and development of top-tier engineering talent.

#### **You Might Be a Fit If You…**

* Have 10+ years of engineering leadership experience in B2B SaaS environments.
* Have built and scaled high-performing engineering teams with strong process and autonomy.
* Bring deep experience in cloud-native architecture (e.g., AWS, GCP), CI/CD, and DevOps.
* Understand what it takes to go from prototype to production – with security, performance, and reliability in mind.
* Have built production-ready AI applications using frameworks like LangChain, RAG, and vector stores.
* Work fluently with AI dev tools like Cursor, Windsurf, or GitHub Copilot.
* Have hands-on experience with LLM APIs from OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Gemini or similar.
* Understand AI as a business enabler – not just a tech feature – and can translate that into product and architecture.
* Thrive in fast-paced, change-oriented environments with global ambitions.
* Are excited by the opportunity to shape an engineering culture where AI is not an add-on – but a core capability.

#### **We’re Especially Interested in Candidates Who…**

* Have led engineering through scaling journeys – team, platform, or product.
* Combine strong architectural insight with a pragmatic builder mindset.
* Know what it means to balance innovation with operational maturity.
* Believe in strong documentation, smart automation, and structured operations.
* Identify as *Entreprenerd* – proactive problem-solvers who move fast with precision and leave nothing to chance.

#### **What We Expect**


We’re raising the bar – and we’re looking for someone who does too. In this role, you are expected to:

* Drive results. You don’t just plan – you ship, measure, and improve.
* Move with clarity. You lead with structure, make trade-offs transparent, and never lose technical integrity.
* Inspire trust. Your team, peers, and stakeholders feel confident in your ownership and leadership.
* Lead with curiosity. You seek smarter, faster, more scalable ways of working – and you bring others with you.
* Balance boldness with detail. You think big, but you don’t overlook the edge cases.
* Show up with energy, humility, and a desire to grow – just like the rest of us.

#### **What We Offer**

* A central role in shaping Learnster’s future as a leading global learning platform.
* A strong engineering foundation to build upon – and a clear mandate to take it to the next level.
* A product and company that are ready for scale – with hundreds of thousands of users and clear market traction.
* A collaborative, forward-leaning leadership team.
* A hybrid setup with modern offices in central Stockholm (Malmskillnadsgatan 32).
* A company culture that values ownership, experimentation, and shared wins.

#### **What Makes Learnster Unique**


Learnster is more than a product. We’re a movement in how organizations treat knowledge. Our customers work with us because we combine strategic thinking, technical excellence, and AI-powered solutions to turn knowledge into business impact. One clear example is Learnster Orchestrator – a pioneering module that empowers knowledge owners to co-create scalable, goal-aligned knowledge initiatives.


We believe great product delivery is a function of great engineering leadership. That’s where you come in.

#### **Interested?**

  

Apply today if you’re ready to help shape the next generation of AI-powered learning platforms, and build an engineering culture that scales, we’d love to meet you.

*Let’s build the future of Knowledge Orchestration. Together.*

title: Business R&D Manager - MACH Main Software Team
description:
**Location:**

Ludvika, Dalarna County, Sweden
**Job ID:**

R0097111
**Date Posted:**

2025-06-27
**Company Name:**

HITACHI ENERGY SWEDEN AB
**Profession (Job Category):**

Engineering & Science
**Job Schedule:**

Full time
**Remote:**

No
**Job Description:**

**The opportunity**

  

You will be leading a team of embedded software developers that are working for the cutting-edge MACH platform. This team is part of the MACH Control and Protection team, which is in turn hosted by the GI MACH organization.


Our success is made possible by the dedication and competence of our people. Knowing this means we need leaders with a focus on developing and empowering their team and a dedication to the Hitachi Energy company values. We offer you an exciting and dynamic role with close collaboration with other departments and teams at Hitachi Energy globally.


**How you’ll make an impact**

* Manage the Embedded Software team within MACH C&P of 12+ people.
* Proactively evolve with - and beyond - industry software standards, quality, cyber security, and CD/CI.
* Work on lifecycle solutions including operating systems, licenses, 3rd part libraries and virtual environment.
* Review & follow-up with the project team/stakeholders for the team’s deliverables, as per the processes.
* Responsible for achieving KPI’s for the team (e.g., On Time Delivery, Quality, Efficiency / Productivity etc.)
* Be part of the recruitment and onboarding process for the team members. Set and follow up on annual people’s goals, time reporting, and salary review.

**Your background**

* The successful candidate shall have an M.Sc. or B.Sc. in Engineering or similar area, with background in software development or similar fields.
* Prior managerial experience is preferable but not a must.
* Knowledge in:
	+ Operational systems.
	+ Virtual Machines and hypervisors.
	+ Azure DevOps.
	+ Yocto Linux.
	+ Git.
	+ C++ and C#.
	+ Industrial communication protocols like IEC61850 and OPCUA.
* Prior knowledge of MACH platform or Control and Protection technologies is an advantage but not a must.
* You are a self-motivated and reliable team player with an independent and result-oriented working style, as well as having strong communicative and collaborative skills.
* Good intercultural sensitivity; training, coaching and mentoring skills.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**

Are you ready for a new exciting challenge? Does the above description sound like you? Don’t delay – apply today! Due to the summer vacation period, the selection process may take longer than usual. We appreciate your patience and understanding.


Recruiting Manager Samarth Deo, samarth.deo@hitachienergy.com, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29 86; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85. All other questions can be directed to Talent Acquisition Gustaf Hedström, gustaf.hedstrom@hitachienergy.com

You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**

title: Enterprise Solutions Architect
description:
DESCRIPTION


Are you passionate about cloud technology and helping customers innovate?  

Join our AWS Solutions Architecture team in Stockholm and empower enterprises across industries to innovate at speed and scale with cloud technologies.  

  

As a Solutions Architect at AWS, you’ll build technical relationships with customers of all sizes and operate as their trusted advisor, ensuring they get the most out of the cloud at every stage of their journey.  

  

You’ll manage the overall technical relationship between AWS and our customers, making recommendations on security, cost, performance, reliability and operational efficiency to accelerate their challenging, mission-critical projects.  

  

Internally, you will be the voice of the customer, sharing their needs and wants to inform the roadmap of AWS features.  

In this role, your creativity will link technology to tangible solutions, with the opportunity to define cloud-native reference architectures for a variety of use cases.  

  

You will participate in the creation and sharing of best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts) and evangelize and educate about AWS technology (e.g. through workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).  

This role is within the Europe North organization (Sweden) and you would be working with Enterprise customers.  

  

If you can educate AWS customers about the art of the possible, while challenging the impossible... come build the future with us!  

  

AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector.  

  

A day in the life  

Diverse Experiences  

AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.  

  

Why AWS?  

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.  

  

Inclusive Team Culture  

Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.  

  

Mentorship & Career Growth  

We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.  

  

Work/Life Balance  

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.  

Represent your region vis-à-vis AWS product teams and influence our GenAI & AI/ML roadmap to best support your customers.  

Work with account teams, AWS specialists (solution architects, data scientists) and partners to deliver results for your customers.  

  

About the team  

The Specialists Organization, within Amazon Global Sales Organization (AGS), positions AWS as the leading platform for GenAI and AI/ML workloads. We enable customers to become data-driven organizations and scale their AI capabilities. Working backwards from customer needs, we execute go-to-market plans as specialist sales and with our solution architect teams. As an AGS team member, you'll guide customers throughout their AWS journey, from new service ideation to accelerating adoption of established solutions. We think big, deliver exceptional results, and collaborate across AWS as #OneTeam.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* Background in any of the following: Cloud Architecture, Systems Design, Software Development, Infrastructure Architecture, Data Engineering or DevOps
* Technical Degree (Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or equivalent) and/or relevant tech experience.
* Fluent written and verbal communication skills in English
* A passion for technology and for learning

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Experience designing, building, refactoring or operating large scale and impactful IT systems - either on premises or in the cloud
* Working knowledge of cloud native architectures
* Knowledge of a modern programming language (Python, JavaScript, Go, .Net, Java, etc.) and/or scripting, Infrastructure as Code etc.
* In-depth working knowledge in a technology domain such as distributed internet-scale web or mobile applications, DevOps, Serverless, Big Data, Analytics, Machine Learning, enterprise workloads (SAP, VMware, Windows etc.), high-performance databases (SQL and/or NoSQL), complex networking implementations, highly secured workloads etc.
* Experience working in a customer-facing role or a role which involved public speaking
* AWS certification (e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate or Professional) or other industry certification
* Fluent written and verbal communication skills in Swedish

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Solutions Architect

title: Cloud Engineer
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
**Vill du arbeta på en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser?**
 Vi söker en erfaren och resultatorienterad Cloud Engineer för att förstärka vårt framstående team hos oss på Sopra Steria. I rollen som Cloud Engineer kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att leda och driva våra projekt inom molnteknik. Du kommer att samarbeta med stora och spännande företag för att utveckla och automatisera infrastruktur och applikationer på molnplattformar. Din passion för modern teknik och arkitektur kommer att vara avgörande när du stöttar Sveriges största företag i att säkert och korrekt utnyttja publika och privata molntjänster.
   

  

**Vi letar efter dig som har:**
* 5-8 års erfarenhet av molnteknik, med fördjupad kompetens inom Azure och/eller AWS.
* Erfarenhet av PaaS, Microservices och Container-teknik.
* Färdigheter inom design och hantering av omfattande Public Cloud-arkitektur.
* Kompetens inom scripting, automation och Infrastructure-as-Code (t.ex. Terraform, Chef, Puppet, Ansible, ARM).
* Erfarenhet av Agila leveransmodeller och DevOps-processer.
* Relevanta certifieringar inom molnteknik är meriterande.


 Vi satsar stort på molnteknik och du kommer att arbeta i team som direkt stödjer vår investering. Du kommer att få möjlighet att arbeta med duktiga kollegor, i spännande projekt.
   

  

**Om Sopra Steria**
 Sopra Steria är en global aktör inom digital transformation med över 60 000 medarbetare i över 30 länder varav 600 i Sverige. Vi har utsetts till en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser 2024 och Karriärföretag flera år i rad. Vi står inför en spännande tillväxtresa, och här får du möjlighet att skapa verklig förändring genom digital utveckling.
   

  

 Ansökan: Om du är redo att vara en del av vår kultur och bidra till vår tillväxtresa, ser vi fram emot att läsa din ansökan och CV. För eventuella frågor angående tjänsten, kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Teodor Nellvik (teodor.nellvik@soprasteria.com).
   

  

 På Sopra Steria ställer vi höga krav på både kompetens och säkerhetsmedvetenhet hos våra medarbetare. Innan en eventuell anställning kommer du därför att genomgå en bakgrundskontroll, och vid intervju behöver du kunna uppvisa giltig legitimation.
   

  

 Sopra Steria tar inte emot CV:n från företag som vi inte har ramavtal tillsammans med. Vi tar inte ansvar för eventuella avgifter på CV:n som skickas oönskat till oss.
   

  

 To all recruitment agencies without a base agreement: Sopra Steria does not accept resumes from agencies with whom we do not have an agreement. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Sopra Steria employees or any other company location. Sopra Steria is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
**Hello Network!** 




  





**For our client we are looking for a
 
 Cloud Security Engineer for Google Cloud Platform:**




  





**Duration: 4 months + chance of extensions** 




**Location: Stockholm (Hybrid Working)** 




**Pay Rate: Negotiable** 




**Language: English Speaking Accepted** 




  





**Job Role:** 




  




* We are looking for a Cloud Platform Engineer with hands-on experience in GCP infrastructure and platform engineering to join our client’s central cloud platform team. The team is responsible for building and maintaining the GCP landing zone, governance frameworks, and central services that enable product teams to securely and efficiently deploy applications and analytics in the cloud.
* This role requires deep knowledge of GCP architecture and components (e.g., IAM, networking, logging, monitoring), proficiency in Terraform, and a track record of automating infrastructure and enabling self-service capabilities. You’ll work on foundational elements like Shared VPCs, Workload Identity Federation (WIF), and centralized policy enforcement, as well as collaborate with product teams to provide best practices and architectural support.



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Enhance and maintain the
 **GCP landing zone** 
 , including governance, networking, and security frameworks
* Design, build, and manage
 **central platform services** 
 (e.g., BigQuery quota control, WIF, PAM integrations)
* Implement and improve
 **automation and self-service capabilities** 
 across the platform
* Provide architectural guidance and support to product and analytics teams on GCP services (e.g., IAM, VPC, Cloud Run, Vertex AI)
* Contribute to defining and enforcing best practices around infrastructure, security, observability, and cost optimization
* Collaborate with stakeholders such as Security, DevOps, and Application Teams to ensure compliance and scalability of cloud solutions



  





**Required Qualifications:** 



* 3+ years of
 **hands-on experience with GCP** 
 , particularly in platform engineering and infrastructure architecture
* Proven experience with
 **Terraform** 
 and infrastructure-as-code practices
* Deep understanding of
 **GCP services** 
 such as IAM, VPC, Cloud Monitoring, BigQuery, and Cloud Run
* Experience in managing
 **Shared VPC** 
 , setting up
 **Workload Identity Federation (WIF)** 
 , and developing central platform policies
* Strong scripting skills (e.g., Python, Bash, or similar)
* Experience working in large-scale environments with a
 **platform team or cloud center of excellence**
* Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams



  





**Nice to Have:** 



* Experience with
 **policy-as-code frameworks** 
 (e.g., OPA/Constraint Templates)
* Familiarity with
 **Vertex AI** 
 or
 **GCP-native ML/analytics workflows**



  





**If you are interested, or you know someone that could be please reach out and we can arrange a time to speak?**

title: Dev Ops Engineer
description:
**Role Overview**
 We are looking for a Dev Ops engineer with experience in building and managing high-performing and scalable systems capable of handling a massive number of transactions.
   

  

 Our platform is built on containerised microservices that we deploy to the cloud through a modern continuous deployment system. If you enjoy working in complex environments and like to exercise your skills in automation while experimenting with new technology then this role could be a great fit.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
 You will be part of a small and high performing team taking care of our Operational environment. You will take full responsibility for the provisioning, development and monitoring of our infrastructure, therefore a solid understanding of modern computing technology is essential and knowledge of cloud environments is beneficial.
   

  

 Some of the tools you will be working with include:
   

  

* GitOps (ArgoCD, Pulumi, Helm, Python, Ansible)
* Linux (e.g. Ubuntu, CentOS, etc.)
* Kubernetes (EKS, kubespray)
* Databases (Oracle, Postgres, MySQL)
* Webservers (e.g. Nginx, Apache, Lighttpd, etc.)
* Version Control (Git)
* Shell Scripting (sh, BASH, etc.)
* TCP/IP Networking (IPv4 & IPv6)


**Your profile**
* At least 3 years of experience of Dev Ops
* Experience of working with cloud platforms (in particular AWS)
* Experience of on premises infrastructure is beneficial
* Solid Kubernetes experience is essential
* You understand the demands of a high data volume system
* You can quickly pick up an understanding of the business you are working with and are able to convert that knowledge into technical solutions that fulfill client needs
* Excellent written and verbal communication in English is essential


**Why us?**
 Tradedoubler is an international performance marketing partner, creating smarter results for its clients and partners through traffic, technology and expertise. We help our clients grow their online sales and find new customers for their businesses and we help an expanding network of online publishers monetise their websites.
   

  

 Working at Tradedoubler is stimulating, challenging and fun. We pride ourselves in offering an environment where everyone can contribute and make a difference to the success of our business. Our employees come from all over the world, producing a culturally diverse environment where creativity, communication and idea sharing are highly valued.
   

  

 We recognise that our employees are the key to our success and with this in mind we offer competitive salaries and benefits as well as the opportunity for every employee to grow with us.
   

  

**About Us**
 Tradedoubler is a global partner marketing network that has been facilitating connections between result-driven brands and publishers worldwide for more than 25 years. We operate in 90+ markets across the globe and house over 2,000 brands and 180,000 publishers in our network. Our awesome teams are located across our 15 offices in Europe and Australia.
   

  

 In addition to Tradedoubler's core Partner Marketing business, we offer digital marketing solutions across the entire customer journey, including App marketing (Appiness), influencer marketing (Metapic), lead generation campaigns (Leadslab), & SaaS solutions (Grow by Tradedoubler).
   

  

 Tradedoubler was founded in 1999 in Stockholm, Sweden by Martin Lorentzon & Felix Hägnö, and has been listed on the Stockholm Stock Exchange since 2005.
   

  

 One of our strong beliefs at Tradedoubler is that our success stems from adhering to our core values: Make it Happen, Stay Curious, & Achieve Together.

title: Cloud Security Engineer
description:
Role : Cloud Security Engineer for Google Cloud Platform
 



 Location : Stockholm (SE)
 



 Remote : 50%
 



 Contract : 1 year
 



 Contact Email : anusha.kusuma@cubane.se
 



 Contact person : Anusha Kusuma
 



  





 Assignment description :
 



 For our client we are looking for a Cloud Security Engineer for Google Cloud Platform.
 



 ﻿
 



 We are looking for a Cloud Platform Engineer with hands-on experience in GCP infrastructure and platform engineering to join our client’s central cloud platform team. The team is responsible for building and maintaining the GCP landing zone, governance frameworks, and central services that enable product teams to securely and efficiently deploy applications and analytics in the cloud.
 



 ﻿
 



 This role requires deep knowledge of GCP architecture and components (e.g., IAM, networking, logging, monitoring), proficiency in Terraform, and a track record of automating infrastructure and enabling self-service capabilities. You’ll work on foundational elements like Shared VPCs, Workload Identity Federation (WIF), and centralized policy enforcement, as well as collaborate with product teams to provide best practices and architectural support.
 



 ﻿
 



 \*\*Key Responsibilities\*\*:
 



 Enhance and maintain the GCP landing zone, including governance, networking, and security frameworks
 



 Design, build, and manage central platform services (e.g., BigQuery quota control, WIF, PAM integrations)
 



 Implement and improve automation and self-service capabilities across the platform
 



 Provide architectural guidance and support to product and analytics teams on GCP services (e.g., IAM, VPC, Cloud Run, Vertex AI)
 



 Contribute to defining and enforcing best practices around infrastructure, security, observability, and cost optimization
 



 Collaborate with stakeholders such as Security, DevOps, and Application Teams to ensure compliance and scalability of cloud solutions
 



 ﻿
 



 \*\*Required Qualifications\*\*:
 



 3+ years of hands-on experience with GCP, particularly in platform engineering and infrastructure architecture
 



 Proven experience with Terraform and infrastructure-as-code practices
 



 Deep understanding of GCP services such as IAM, VPC, Cloud Monitoring, BigQuery, and Cloud Run
 



 Experience in managing Shared VPC, setting up Workload Identity Federation (WIF), and developing central platform policies
 



 Strong scripting skills (e.g., Python, Bash, or similar)
 



 Experience working in large-scale environments with a platform team or cloud center of excellence
 



 Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams
 



 ﻿
 



 \*\*Nice to Have\*\*:
 



 Experience with policy-as-code frameworks (e.g., OPA/Constraint Templates)
 



 Familiarity with Vertex AI or GCP-native ML/analytics workflows
 



 Experience in building internal developer platforms or portals

title: Senior Test Engineer
description:
**Key Responsibilities**
* Design and implement comprehensive test strategies and plans for complex systems and applications.
* Define test objectives, scope, and success criteria in collaboration with product and development teams.
* Develop, maintain, and execute automated test scripts using tools such as Selenium, Cypress, or similar.
* Perform manual testing when necessary, including exploratory, regression, and user acceptance testing.
* Ensure thorough test coverage across functional, integration, performance, and security domains.
* Identify, document, and track defects using tools like JIRA or Azure DevOps.
* Collaborate with developers to troubleshoot and resolve issues efficiently.
* Manage and maintain code repositories (e.g., Git, Bitbucket), ensuring proper version control, branching strategies, and code promotion workflows to support testing and release processes.
* Participate in code reviews to ensure testability, maintainability, and adherence to coding standards.
* Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins, GitLab CI, or similar platforms.
* Work closely with DevOps teams to ensure test environments are stable and reflective of production.
* Lead test efforts for major releases and coordinate cross-functional testing activities.
* Champion quality best practices across the organization.
* Participate in design discussions to ensure quality is considered early in the development lifecycle.
* Provide detailed test reports, metrics, and dashboards to stakeholders.
* Analyze test results and trends to drive continuous improvement.


**Qualifications**
* Proven Testing experience, preferably in banking or financial services.
* 5+ years of experience in software testing, with a focus on automation and CI/CD.
* Proficiency in test automation frameworks & scripting languages (e.g., Python, JavaScript, etc.).
* Strong understanding of software development methodologies (Agile, Scrum).
* Experience with performance and security testing tools is a plus.


 Skills: database migration,git,jenkins,bitbucket,automation,python,jira,security testing,selenium,manual testing,agile,testing,javascript,performance testing,devops,azure devops,cypress,gitlab ci,scripting languages,automated testing

title: DevOps
description:
**Vill du ha ett meningsfullt arbete och bidra till ett säkrare Sverige i en osäker värld?**
 Det förändrade omvärldsläget medför att vårt försvar behöver förstärkas och den ökade underrättelseverksamheten mot Sverige och Försvarsmakten är omfattande. Den Militära underrättelse- och säkerhetstjänsten (Must) bedriver verksamhet inom försvarsunderrättelsetjänst, militär underrättelsetjänst och militär säkerhetstjänst.
   

  

**Vårt erbjudande**
 Vi erbjuder ett viktigt och stimulerande arbete där du dagligen bidrar till Sveriges säkerhet. Vi erbjuder också mycket goda möjligheter till kompetensutveckling. Hos oss finns det friskvårdsmöjligheter som inkluderar träning på arbetstid samt möjlighet att ha balans mellan arbete och fritid.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som DevOps med inriktning mot automatisering kommer du få vara med oss i resan med målet att bygga upp vårt privata moln. Du bygger upp och sköter infrastrukturen i grunden likväl som att du administrerar våra Kuberneteskluster som utgör basen i plattformen. I rollen ingår det också att hjälpa till att utveckla och bygga på Kubernetes plattformen med olika utvecklarnära tjänster för att på så vis skapa ett attraktivt erbjudande för våra interna kunder. Som många andra IT organisationer har vi legacy system att förhålla oss till och även där kommer du behöva bidra.
   

  

 Beredskap kan förekomma.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Akademisk utbildning inom datateknik alternativt annan utbildning eller erfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer som likvärdig.
* Mycket god förståelse för teknisk infrastruktur.
* Mycket god Linux kunskaper.
* Flera års erfarenhet i någon Kubernetes plattform så som openshift, Rancher eller liknande.
* Erfarenhet av verktyg för automation och konfiguration såsom Ansible och Terraform.
* God förståelse för GitOps som process och verktyg för detta.


**Meriterande**
* Arbetat med publika molntjänster såsom AWS eller motsvarande.
* Erfarenhet inom Windows server och active directory
* Kunskap inom scripting så som tex bash och python.
* Kunskap inom nätverk och hårdvara.


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Som person har du mycket gott omdöme. Du är trygg, stabil och har självinsikt. Du är självgående, strukturerad och tar ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter. Du tar intiativ, sätter igång aktiviteter och uppnår resultat. Du kommer ofta med ideér och nya angreppssätt i arbetsrelaterade frågor. Du har en god samarbetsförmåga, samt lyssnar och kommunicerar på ett konstruktivt sätt.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Placeringsort: Stockholm. Befattningen är civil. Tillsvidareanställning med tillträde snarast enligt överenskommelse. Försvarsmakten tillämpar sex månaders provanställning. Urval kommer att ske löpande.
   

  

**För upplysningar om befattningen eller rekryteringsprocessen kontakta:**
 hkv-rekrytering-must@mil.se, vänligen skriv "41968" i ämnesraden.
   

  

**Fackliga företrädare**
 Fackliga representanter nås via hkv-rekrytering-must@mil.se
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan senast
 **2025-08-31** 
 Din ansökan ska innehålla CV samt ett personligt brev där du motiverar varför du är lämpad för denna befattning.
   

  

**Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via Försvarsmaktens webbplats.**
**Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via Försvarsmaktens webbplats.** 
 -------------------------------------------------------- Militära underrättelse- och säkerhetstjänsten (Must) är en del av Försvarsmaktens högkvarter i Stockholm. Vi ger regeringen och Försvarsmakten kvalificerade beslutsunderlag om omvärldsutvecklingen och hot mot Sveriges och Försvarsmaktens säkerhet. Vår vision är ”Ett säkrare Sverige i en osäker värld”. Must är en kunskapsorganisation och erbjuder både spännande och för Sverige angelägna arbetsuppgifter. Här arbetar både officerare och civila experter inom olika områden, t ex statsvetenskap, IT, ekonomi, teknik, matematik och HR. En stor del av Must verksamhet omfattas av sekretess och vi ber dig därför att inte berätta att du sökt jobb hos Must för andra personer än dina närmaste. Läs gärna mer om Must och vår verksamhet här Varje dag och varje timme gör våra medarbetare insatser som påverkar andra människors liv, både i stort och smått, och både på hemmaplan och runt om i världen. Försvarsmakten ger dig möjlighet att utvecklas som människa och växa i din professionella roll. Vi är en ansvarstagande arbetsgivare och har en öppen organisation där vi ställer upp för varandra. I Försvarsmakten finns en stark värdegrund som bygger på öppenhet, resultat och ansvar. Professionell utveckling och personlig hälsa värdesätts och uppmuntras. Det finns goda förutsättningar för intern karriärrörlighet, friskvård och bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Försvarsmakten tillvaratar de kvaliteter som mångfald och jämn könsfördelning tillför verksamheten. Vi välkomnar därför sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter i våra rekryteringar. En anställning hos oss innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Vanligtvis krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före anställning enligt 3 kap i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. I anställningen ingår även en skyldighet att tjänstgöra utomlands. Innebörden av detta varierar beroende på typ av befattning. Till ansökan om anställning ska CV och personligt brev bifogas. Om du går vidare i anställningsprocessen ska alltid vidimerade kopior av betyg och intyg uppvisas. Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.

title: Cloud Architect Azure
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
**Vill du arbeta på en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser?**
 Sopra Steria, Nordens ledande företag inom digital transformation, söker en erfaren och kompetent Cloud Architect inom Azure med dokumenterad erfarenhet för att stärka vårt framstående team. Vi har blivit erkända som Karriärföretag och en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser 2024 av Great Place to Work. I denna roll kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i leveransen av innovativa molnbaserade projekt till våra kunder samt bidra till vidareutvecklingen av vårt framstående molnerbjudande
   

  

**Som arkitektkonsult inom Azure kommer du att:**
* Delta aktivt i planering, design och implementation av Azure-lösningar för våra kunder.
* Operativt arbeta med lösningar som omfattar hela bredden av Azure-plattformen, inklusive IaaS och PaaS, med fokus på Entra ID för identitets- och åtkomststyrning.
* Coacha och vägleda kunder om optimal användning av moln- och hybridteknologi för att implementera nya lösningar eller migrera befintliga tjänster till Azure.
* Fungera som ämnesexpert som stödjer flera team eller som teknisk teamledare med övergripande ansvar för leveransen.


**För att lyckas med detta tror vi att du:**
* 5 till 8 års dokumenterad erfarenhet som Azure-arkitekt med stark tekniskt fokus och problemlösningsförmåga.
* Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Förmåga att automatisera och optimera arbetsflöden.
* Erfarenhet av att översätta kundens behov till konkreta designförslag och implementeringar.
* Erfarenhet från konsultbranschen med förmåga att arbeta i både stora och små team.


**Kvalifikationer och färdigheter:**
* Erfarenhet av design och implementering av lösningar i det publika molnet, med fokus på kostnadsoptimering, säkerhet, skalbarhet, prestanda och tillgänglighet.
* Kompetens inom programmerings- och/eller skriptspråk (Powershell, Bash, Python etc.).
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD-verktyg som Azure DevOps eller GitHub.
* Erfarenhet av Infrastructure as Code (ARM, Bicep, Terraform etc.).
* Förståelse och erfarenhet av ramverk som Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework, Security Adoption Framework samt Well-Architected Framework
* Kunskap inom molnsäkerhet och Zero Trust arkitektur.
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av containerlösningar som Docker och Kubernetes är meriterande.


**Om Sopra Steria:**
 Sopra Steria är en global aktör inom digital transformation med över 50 000 medarbetare i över 30 länder, varav 600 i Sverige. Vi har blivit rankade som en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser 2024 av Great Place to Work och är ett av topp fem bolag inom Digital Transformation enligt Gartner. Vi erbjuder en inkluderande och skicklig arbetsmiljö där du har möjlighet att vässa dina kunskaper och arbeta med branschens mest spännande projekt. Vi står nu inför en spännande tillväxtresa som genomsyrar hela verksamheten där det finns stora möjligheter att växa tillsammans med bolaget och skapa verklig förändring genom digital utveckling.
   

  

 Har du fler frågor? Om du har några fler frågor angående tjänsten får du gärna höra av dig till ansvarig rekryterare Teodor Nellvik (teodor.nellvik@soprasteria.com).
   

  

 På Sopra Steria ställer vi höga krav på både kompetens och säkerhetsmedvetenhet hos våra medarbetare. Innan en eventuell anställning kommer du därför att genomgå en bakgrundskontroll, och vid intervju behöver du kunna uppvisa giltig legitimation.
   

  

 Sopra Steria tar inte emot CV:n från företag som vi inte har ramavtal tillsammans med. Vi tar inte ansvar för eventuella avgifter på CV:n som skickas oönskat till oss. To all recruitment agencies without a base agreement: Sopra Steria does not accept resumes from agencies with whom we do not have an agreement. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Sopra Steria employees or any other company location. Sopra Steria is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Platform Engineer till Accelerate at Iver
description:
Är du redo att forma framtidens IT tillsammans med några av branschens vassaste konsulter? Accelerate at Iver växer – och vi söker fler Platform Engineers som vill vara med och bygga smarta, hållbara och säkra lösningar i teknikens absoluta framkant.
   

  

****💼** 
**Din roll****
 Som en del av vårt DevOps-team får du arbeta med marknadsledande kunder och hjälpa dem genom deras digitala transformation. Du jobbar långsiktigt i teamleveranser med modernisering, automation och agil utveckling – enligt vår metodik
 *Journey* 
 to Agile. Några av de tekniker/metoder som vi arbetar med är Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform, Jenkins, Ansible, Git, Bash, Python.
   

  

******✅** 
 Vem är du?****
 Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet inom Plattform/DevOps och som brinner för automatisering och att bygga effektiva lösningar ute hos våra kunder. Du uttrycker dig obehindrat på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.
   

  

 För denna position krävs svenskt medborgarskap, vi utför även bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat.
   

  

**🛠️ Du Bör Ha Koll På**
* Linux i enterprise-miljöer
* Containerteknik: Docker, Kubernetes
* Script/programmering: Bash, Python, Go
* Versionshantering: Git
* Automatisering: Ansible, Terraform
* CI/CD och GitOps


**Extra Plus Om Du Även Har Koll På**
* OpenStack
* Public cloud
* OpenShift/Rancher
* HashiCorp Vault/Consul


****🌱** 
**Vi** 
 erbjuder dig**
 Som anställd på Accelerate at Iver erbjuder vi förutom spännande uppdrag och tekniker:
   

  

* Utbildning & certifieringar via våra partners (Red Hat, HashiCorp, GitLab m.fl.)
* En trygg och säker anställning med bra förmåner
* Kollektivavtal, friskvårdsbidrag och sjukvårdsförsäkring
* Flexibilitet, frihet och balans mellan jobb och fritid
* Att bli en del i ett passionerat team med tekniskt vassa kollegor


 Vi tror på gemenskap och kompetensutbyte – här utvecklas vi tillsammans och stöttar varandra för att alltid ligga i framkant.
   

  

**📍Placeringsort**
 Accelerate at Iver finns på flertal orter i Sverige och Norge. För denna tjänst utgår du från vårt kontor i Stockholm, med möjlighet till hybridarbete.
   

  

**Vi intervjuar löpande – vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan!**
 👉 Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Har du frågor? Kontakta Jesper Carlsson på jesper.carlsson@iver.se
   

  

**Vi ser fram emot att träffa dig. Välkommen til** 
**l Accelerate at Iver!** 
 🚀
   

  

**We empower our Nordic society** 
 . Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation.
   

  

**Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.** 
 Vi säkerställer att sjukvården har tillgång till rätt patientdata, att samhällskritiska system aldrig ligger nere och att flygplanen landar säkert. Som en lyhörd och affärsnära helhetspartner möjliggör vi våra kunders innovation – idag och imorgon.

title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer, Data Platform
description:
**Senior Site Reliability Engineer, Data Platform
   

  

 THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELL**
**You?** 
 A skilled Senior Site Reliability Engineer with a passion for building agile data platforms in a Data Mesh environment.
   

  

**Role?** 
 Develop and maintain an Internal Developer Platform, handling tasks from coding to communication across teams.
   

  

**Location?** 
 Join us at any of our offices in Oslo, Stockholm or Helsinki with the flexibility to work remotely 2-3 days a week, your choice, your balance.
   

  

**Why us?** 
 You have the opportunity to elevate your software craftsmanship by building an Internal Developer Platform in a Data Mesh and international environment, at the scale of millions of end-users, all contributing to a sustainable circular economy.
   

  

 We're looking to build the most agile data platform possible: simple, compact, clear, modular, and extensible components fitting a data mesh (not mess) architecture.
   

  

**WHAT'S THE JOB LIKE?**
* Code. You will touch primarily scripts and configuration files. Much of the scripting happens in BASH, some in straightforward Python/NodeJS, orchestrated via Makefiles and at times containerized in Docker. We enable both AWS and GCP as cloud providers. Our IaC tool is terraform. Our code is version controlled by git, hosted on Github Enterprise, automated heavily via Github Actions.
* Dayta or dahta? The building blocks are blob storage (S3/GCS), Kafka, Snowflake, dbt core and Tableau, targeting ELT pipelines. You might not write SQL and run queries on a daily basis, but you will interact with the SQL world nevertheless. You will support handling of sensitive data through IAM, encryption and data masking.
* Communicate. As we are distributed throughout the Nordics, a great deal of communication happens in Slack and Google Meet. You will interact with a wide-range of colleagues in engineering, product, insights and analytics, BI, domain teams, services and more, as platform engineering has a wide spectrum of upstream and downstream dependencies.
* Manage tasks. You will own your tasks and PRs visible on a Kanban board, as well as initiate and participate in asynchronous communication in Github Issues and PRs. Your tasks will vary from designing, building, monitoring and maintaining scalable and secure solutions, eliciting requirements, defining ways forward, assessing and suggesting alternatives, etc.
* Practice software craftsmanship in the data world.


**WHO ARE YOU?**
* You need to have 3+ years of experience in software engineering in the field of self-service platform development of high-availability systems.
* You need to feel at home with Linux, cloud engineering, serverless, containers, infrastructure as code, automation, git.
* You need to be comfortable and to enjoy written communication in English, ranging from instant messaging, task management and code review, to self-service documentation.
* You embrace the Linux philosophy, you're comfortable with and enjoy working with the terminal, scripting (BASH) and build automation (Make) in specific, and GNU software in general.
* You embrace a DevOps mindset around automation of software development, collaboration and communication, continuous and lean software development, and hyperfocus on user needs being addressed with short feedback loops. Cloud engineering, serverless and containerization, infrastructure as code.
* You embrace an open-source mindset that favors transparency, async discussions, humility, quality, modularity, outside contributions, collective knowledge, agility, among others. Meritory if you are publicly active in the open-source space.
* You keep a balance between being pragmatic with production-quality choices while bringing in new perspectives for low-risk choices, no matter if it's the latest-and-greatest or some proven-but-forgotten technology. Research, argue for and against, seek compromise. Good enough is better than perfect.
* You might have experience in data engineering. It is not required in itself, but obviously extremely meritory as it will help you communicate and empathize with our colleagues and stakeholders, and thus enabling high-ROI solutions. If you haven't heard of Data Mesh, please have a look, internalize the principles and make sure you align with them.
* You might have experience in platform engineering (e.g. K8s). It is not required in itself, but meritory as it will be a net-positive contributor in terms of ways of working and thinking
* YOU! In short, we're looking for you!


 Who will be your closest colleagues
   

  

* Together we are a team of 5 individuals, equally distributed in Stockholm and Helsinki, meeting digitally daily, meeting physically regularly in one of our Nordic locations, for larger meetups but also for ad-hoc work-from-another-office visits. We are only one out of many teams of talented individuals with diverse backgrounds, intellects and identities.
* Hi, I'm Dagmar! I've been a Data Engineer at Schibsted for 3 years and enjoyed every bit of it. I get to work with modern technologies, varied technology stacks, international colleagues and on interesting data from Finland's biggest marketplace and real estate sites. Being a multinational with English as the working language, we get to cooperate with diverse people and inspire each other from our experiences. The company culture values open-minded people, supports everyone to succeed in their work, gain new knowledge and creates opportunities to hang out outside of work hours.
* Andrei here! I'll be your new manager, doing my very best to support you in navigating the organization, the processes, the mission, the daily tasks, your career, but most importantly supporting you to be the best that you can be. My career is strongly rooted in a wide spectrum of software engineering challenges, and I believe the potential for our team to make a net-positive change is monumental.


**GOT YOUR ATTENTION?** 
 Let us hear from you!
   

  

 If you're a passionate Site Reliability Engineer eager to contribute to a sustainable circular economy, we want to hear from you! Apply by
 **August 10th 2025** 
 . We value diversity and welcome applicants from all backgrounds. All applications will be reviewed after the deadline date.
   

  

**QUESTIONS?**
 Hi! My name is Andrei, and I am the hiring manager for this role. I am happy to provide information about the position and answer any questions you may have, so please reach out through (andrei.neculau@vend.com) if you have any questions!

title: Platform Engineer
description:
**Introducing evroc**
 At evroc, we are building a secure, sovereign, and sustainable hyperscale cloud to reimagine the digital future of Europe. By joining our company, you have an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development of next-generation cloud services. We are seeking intellectually curious and highly motivated team members who are ready to embrace the thrilling challenge of building the first European owned hyperscale cloud.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Job type:** 
 Permanent position
   

  

**Join the Pioneers**
 At the outset of our journey, we're not just building software; we're laying the groundwork for our technology solutions and how we’ll operate as an engineering team. As we expand, the organisation of our teams and the specialisation into product areas hinge on these formative decisions. Coming on board now means you're not just coding — you're contributing directly to how we set ourselves up for success, how we tackle challenges, and how we define our engineering culture. This isn’t just a job; it's a chance to leave an indelible mark on our technology, teams, culture, and ethos.
   

  

**What You'll Tackle**
* Build and design the foundational infrastructure for other engineering teams and customers to build on. Our team is responsible for automating the provisioning and setup of evroc's platform to ensure speed, reliability, and scalability.
* Create Infrastructure-as-Code deployments and large scale cluster configurations for managing our networking, storage, and compute resources.
* Seamlessly integrate and upkeep open-source components within our evolving tech stack.
* Team up with fellow engineers to craft tailored solutions meeting our unique challenges.
* Forge and refine tools that power team efficiency - this includes CI/CD, local development setups, build toolchains, and essential infrastructure.
* Plot the roadmap for software component development, aligning with team priorities and vision.
* Lead the charge in defining and achieving our technical benchmarks.


**Skills We Value**
* Proficiency in distributed systems and Linux systems engineering.
* Strong understanding of various infrastructure technologies, including virtualization, containerization, and cloud computing.
* Coding in programming languages such as (but not exclusively) Golang or Rust.
* Experience in building and enhancing compute, storage, and data platforms with exposure to open source products like Kubernetes, Knative, Ceph, Rook and the like.
* Hands-on with infrastructure-as-code tools and automation, such as Terraform, Ansible, or Helm.
* Familiarity with software build processes and secure supply systems, like OpenSSF.
* Strong problem-solving and communication skills to effectively address complex platform engineering challenges.


 We offer a competitive salary and an equity package to attract the best. Whether it’s the cosmopolitan allure of London, the vibrant Stockholm, or the Mediterranean charm of Sophia Antipolis, you’re poised for an inspiring work environment and a captivating local culture!
   

  

 At evroc, diversity is our strength. We champion an inclusive environment where every background - ethnicity, age, gender identity, beliefs, and culture - is celebrated.
   

  

 Applicants must possess a valid work permit.

title: Chief Technology Officer (Gaming)
description:
**We’re looking for a CTO / Technical Director in Sweden (Open to locals, expats, or those ready to relocate)** 




**About the role:** 




 Our client is a fast-growing startup that’s making waves in software and game development, with a strong presence across Asia. They need a hands-on, experienced leader to take charge of their projects, especially in B2B gaming platforms and live streaming. This is a great opportunity to join and build a dynamic and
 
 successful team in the gaming industry.
 




  





**What you’ll do:** 



* Lead and mentor a talented team of project managers, product owners, developers, business analysts, and DevOps pros.
* Oversee the design, development, and deployment of gaming and web applications—ensuring high quality, performance, and scalability.
* Work closely with stakeholders to define project goals, requirements, and timelines.
* Drive innovation, stay on top of industry trends, and continuously improve processes and technologies.
* Collaborate effectively with teams around the world, working across multiple time zones.
* Manage resources efficiently, including local, offshore, and outsourced teams.
* Provide expert technical guidance to keep projects on track and deliver high-quality solutions.
* Monitor industry trends, especially in gaming and live streaming, to keep the company competitive.
* Take full ownership of budgets and costs, ensuring resources are used effectively and projects stay within financial targets.
* Identify blockers early and implement quick, effective solutions.



  





**Who we’re looking for:** 



* 10+ years in a senior leadership role—preferably as a Technical Director or similar.
* Extensive experience with Java, NodeJS, and modern web technologies.
* Proven success leading large-scale web and platform projects, especially in gaming, e-commerce, or fintech sectors.
* Hands-on experience with live-streaming, gaming platforms, or other B2B solutions.
* Demonstrated experience managing multi-million dollar budgets, controlling costs, and ensuring project financials are on point.
* Background working in multinational companies, managing teams across different time zones.
* Strong leadership skills, excellent communication, and the ability to coordinate with dispersed teams.
* Bonus points if you’ve been in the gambling industry!
* Fluency in English is essential.



  





**Recruitment process:** 
 Apply CV -> Phone Screen -> 3 online interview rounds.

title: Senior Cloud Operations Architect, ES - EMEA
description:
**Description**
 Would you like to join one of the fastest-growing organizations within Amazon Web Services (AWS), and help customers of all industries and sizes gain the best value and service from AWS? AWS Enterprise Support, Cloud Operations Architect drive our customers’ creative and transformative spirit of innovation across all technologies - including Compute, Storage, Database, Big Data, Application-level Services, Networking, Serverless, Deployment, Security and more. This is not a sales role, but rather an opportunity to be the principal technical advisor and ‘voice of the customer’ to organizations ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500 enterprises.
   

  

 As a Sr.Cloud Operations Architect, you will help craft and execute strategies to drive our customers’ adoption and use of AWS services - including EC2, S3, DynamoDB & RDS databases, Lambda, CloudFront CDN, IoT, and many more. Your technical acumen and customer-facing skills will enable you to effectively represent AWS within a customer’s environment, and drive discussions with senior leadership regarding incidents, trade-offs, support, and risk management.
   

  

 You will provide advocacy and strategic technical guidance to help plan and build solutions using best practices, and proactively keep your customers’ AWS environments operationally healthy. The close relationships developed with your customers will allow you to understand their business/operational needs and technical challenges, and help them achieve the greatest value from AWS. This position will require the ability to travel 10% or more as needed.
   

  

 The Sr.Cloud Operations Architect is the centerpiece of value to our Enterprise Support customers. If you wish to be at the forefront of innovation, come join us!
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 You’ll advise on solutions, provide technical guidance and advocate for the customer
   

  

* Ensure AWS environments remain operationally healthy whilst reducing cost and complexity
* Develop trusting relationships with customers, understanding their business needs and technical challenges
* Using your technical acumen and customer obsession, you’ll drive technical discussions regarding incidents, trade-offs, and risk management
* Consult with a range of partners from developers through to C-suite executives
* Collaborate with AWS Solutions Architects, Business Developers, Professional Services Consultants, and Sales Account Managers
* With a bias for action, you'll proactively find opportunities for customers to gain additional value from AWS
* Provide detailed reviews of service events, monthly & quarterly metrics, detailed pre-launch planning
* Solve a variety of problems across different customers as they migrate their workloads to the cloud


**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience in a similar role as a Technical Account Manager, Consultant, Solutions Architect, Platform Engineer, Systems Engineer, Cloud Architect etc.
* Understand operational parameters and troubleshooting for four (4) of the following: Compute / Storage / Networking / CDN / Databases / DevOps / Big Data and Analytics / Security / Architecture / Applications Development in a distributed systems environment
* External customer-facing experience with the ability to clearly articulate to small and large audiences
* Ability to juggle tasks and projects in a fast-paced environment


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Professional experience with AWS and/or other cloud offerings such as Azure, Google Cloud Platform etc.
* Programming or scripting skills with a combination of Java, Python Perl, Ruby, C#, and/or PHP
* Previous experience as a Software Engineer, Developer, Solution Architect, DevOps Engineer, etc.
* Understanding of DevOps practices and tools, including: Continuous Integration / Deployment, Puppet, Docker, Kubernetes, Chef etc.


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2975896

title: Senior Data Engineer
company_industry: Business Consulting and Services and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
