title: Software Development Engineer, SYE-Client
description:
DESCRIPTION


Join us in revolutionizing how people experience digital entertainment across global platforms. You'll be at the forefront of developing innovative streaming solutions that transform how millions of viewers consume live sports, original shows, and blockbuster movies.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Develop and optimize client applications and software development kits (SDKs) for seamless video streaming experiences
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement high-performance streaming technologies
* Conduct comprehensive code reviews and provide constructive feedback to enhance software quality
* Investigate and resolve complex technical challenges affecting video playback and user experience
* Drive continuous improvement of streaming platforms across multiple device ecosystems.

  

A day in the life  

Join Amazon Prime Video's streaming low latency organization, working on Sye - our revolutionary streaming platform for live sports. You'll focus on client-side implementation to deliver minimal latency and synchronized playback globally. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, effectively managing both short and long-term projects. You'll debug customer-facing issues, conduct deep-dive analysis, and drive improvements in video quality, latency reduction, and bandwidth optimization. Your work will ensure seamless viewing experiences across various network conditions and devices, directly impacting millions of viewers worldwide.  

  

About the team  

We are a dynamic, collaborative group passionate about creating world-class streaming experiences. Our team values innovation, knowledge sharing, and continuous learning. We're committed to developing talent and creating an inclusive environment where every team member can grow and make meaningful contributions.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* Experience building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers
* Experience in professional, non-internship software development
* Experience programming with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
* Experience with performance optimization and memory management

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent
* Experience with full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations
* Experience in developing and maintaining applications, frameworks or SDKs for Android, iOS, tvOS, Smart TVs, game consoles or web.

title: Firmware Engineer
description:
Elektron builds state-of-the-art electronic music instruments with deep functionality and exceptional sonic capabilities. With a track record of iconic products such as the Machinedrum, Octatrack and Digitakt, Elektron has become uniquely positioned in the artist and producer community.


We’re now expanding our team, to push the edge of music creation and meet customer demand!


With small teams, flat hierarchy, and high emphasis on creativity, Elektron gives room for every idea to be heard! Joining the Elektron team means being trusted in your abilities.


Do you want to be a part of the team that creates the best electronic music instruments in the world?

**Role Description**
--------------------


We are currently looking for a full-time **Firmware Engineer** to expand the R&D team. As a firmware engineer at Elektron you will work with the complete software design chain; from product ideas, through prototype stages, to released firmwares and updates in future releases.


The embedded software team is responsible for all the programmable aspects of the instruments, ranging from digital logic to high level data management. We develop software for products to come, and we continue to improve the software long after they have been released.


Our instruments have multi-threading real-time operating systems, and may be composed of multiple micro-controllers and digital signal processors. You will be working at the application level, but you are required to interface the operating system at a lower level.


You are passionate about writing code which is reliable as well as efficient. You are comfortable working with a large existing codebase. You are self-motivated and have strong problem solving capabilities.

  

This is an on-site position based in Gothenburg, Sweden.

**Required skills & experience**
--------------------------------

* Master of Science in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or similar experience.
* Several years of experience with C++.
* Some experience with Python.
* Extensive embedded systems design knowledge - choosing components, reading schematics, interacting with hardware.
* Good knowledge about Operating Systems and Real-time Systems.
* Great problem-solving skills.
* Low-level knowledge: knows about caches, stack/heap, allocation schemes.
* Experience with software architecture and knows how to write maintainable systems.
* Knows Git inside-out and is well familiar with code review.
* Good knowledge of algorithms and data structures.
* A structured way of working, using version control, issue trackers and similar tools.
* Several years of working experience in a similar field.
* Fluent spoken and written English
* Interest in music instruments (preferably making music)

**Valued skills**
-----------------

* Knowledge in Rust, Digital Signal Processing, USB communication
* Experience with production testing and a drive for testability.
* Experience with major real-time operating systems such as FreeRTOS, Zephyr etc.
* Low level ARM A/M architecture and ISA knowledge.

**What we offer**
-----------------


A dynamic and multicultural workplace where you have the opportunity to make a real impact and take ownership. At Elektron, you’ll experience great team spirit and a warm atmosphere, with music at the heart of everything we do. You’ll work closely with all departments and gain a broad understanding of the company, opening doors for professional development and long-term growth. Along the way, you’ll enjoy regular social events, fresh fruit, free parking, a wellness benefit, and more — all backed by the security of a collective agreement.

**Start:** As soon as possible, by agreement

**Scope:** Full-time, permanent position

**Location:** Banehagsliden 5, Gothenburg

  

**Application deadline:** August 31, 2025

  

Since this ad is posted during the holiday season, we won’t be getting back to you until September — but rest assured, you haven’t been forgotten, and we promise to reach out as soon as we can.


Have a wonderful summer — greetings from Elektron!

title: Portfolio Strategy Professional
description:
**Location:**

Solna, Solna, Sweden
**Job ID:**

R0091520
**Date Posted:**

2025-07-07
**Company Name:**

HITACHI ENERGY SWEDEN AB
**Profession (Job Category):**

Sales, Marketing & Product Management
**Job Schedule:**

Full time
**Remote:**

No
**Job Description:**

**The opportunity:**

Power Conversion Solutions (PCS) is a newly formed Global Product Group (GPG) within Hitachi Energy, created by combining the energy storage system expertise with the power conversion product business. PCS aims to become a high-performing, successful, and attractive partner for developers, IPPs, and integrators by offering an unparalleled package of products, services, and software. Our mission is to drive profitable growth and deliver high-value automation and digital solutions to our customers.


The Portfolio Strategy Professional will play a critical role in the newly formed Power Conversion Solutions (PCS) organization.


This position is responsible for driving the strategy work across the product portfolio and identifies, evaluates and negotiates, new sales, new product and marketing growth opportunities across multiple of the following areas: Business cases, Pricing Strategy, Product portfolio Strategy, New Product Development, Localization and Market Strategies. The work includes supporting strategic partnerships including financial arrangements, customer sharing, and intellectual property rights. Works with the Product cost structure and investments into the product portfolio. Prioritizing and tracking investments across new product development initiatives


This position is based in Solna, Sweden.


**How you will make and impact:**

* Drive the portfolio strategy work in tight collaboration with the respective product managers and the PCS management team.
* Develop and track the overall local/regional pricing strategy and keep an overall portfolio view of product profitability.
* Develop business cases both for new product development but also for expansion of business/manufacturing footprint.
* Collaborate with engineering and product development teams to ensure the overall strategy of the business is reached and clearly implemented across the development activities.
* Be the owner of the key business assumptions and references assuring there is a common base and approach to across the product development activities and targets (volumes, prices, compliance etc.)
* Monitor and analyze performance metrics, identifying areas for improvement and implementing corrective actions as needed to optimize the portfolio and ongoing development activities.
* Support key strategic initiatives across the business and support the needed analysis up until an investment decision.
* Participate in the development of new offerings and business models to meet evolving customer needs and market trends.
Support the sales team in promoting and selling offerings, providing portfolio expertise and articulate customer specific value propositions.  
* 

**Your background:**

* Master’s degree in engineering, business administration, or a related field preferred.
* Minimum of 6 years of experience in a strategy role for engineering companies, preferably in the power conversion, battery energy storage or renewable energy industry.
* Experience with digital and automation business models and value propositions within the broader renewable energy industry.
* Experience in developing and managing strategy development and implementation as well as generating and owning the business case models
* Strong business case & strategy skills, with a proven track record of building and performing investments into new products and business growth
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain strong relationships with customers and internal stakeholders.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make data-driven decisions.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities.

**What we offer:**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks  
*

description:

**Company Name:**

**Job Description:**

**At Hitachi Energy our purpose is advancing a sustainable energy future for all. We bring power to our homes, schools, hospitals and factories. Join us and work with fantastic people, while learning and developing yourself on projects that have a real impact to our communities and society. Bring your passion, bring your energy, and be part of a global team that appreciates a simple truth: Diversity + Collaboration = Great Innovation**

**The opportunity**

Hitachi Energy is looking for a Laboratory test Engineer for the Business Unit Transformers to join our innovative and forward-thinking team in Ludvika. In this role, you will work onsite leading the technical aspects of testing products in the Test center including the definition, planning, execution, and analysis of testing processes. This position offers the opportunity to drive continuous improvement in testing processes, contributing to Hitachi Energy’s vision of delivering smarter and more sustainable energy solutions.


**How you’ll make an impact**

* **Test scope:** Execution of mechanical, electrical, magnetics and climate testing.
* **Test Campaigns** : Prepare, execute, and document test activities, including data acquisition, analysis, and technical reporting.
* **Lab Optimization & Improvement:** Identify opportunities to improve lab processes and standardized tests.
* **Mechanical Setup Development:** Design mechanical fixtures and test setups using 3D CAD tools; create and validate test features.
* **Electrical Setup Development:** Implement instrumentation and data acquisition systems, including sensors, wiring, and network integration.
* **Calibration routines:** Guarantee calibration is up to date in the laboratory.

**Your background**

* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience with hands-on experience in laboratory testing or test engineering environments.
* Experience with sensors, DAQ systems, and electrical instrumentation. improvement of lab processes through automation, scripting, or system optimization is a plus.
* Familiarity in 3D CAD software (e.g., SolidWorks, Creo, or similar).
* Strong analytical skills and ability to work with test data.
* Knowledge of climate/environmental testing is a plus.
* Strong understanding of testing protocols, quality standards, and regulatory compliance (e.g., IEC, IEEE, ISO 9001, ISO 45001).
* Proficiency in data analysis and reporting tools to evaluate test results and performance metrics.
* Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to conduct thorough failure analyses and implement corrective actions.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally

**Job Description:**

**The Opportunity**

HVDC (High Voltage Direct Current) is a business unit within Hitachi Energy. The unit develops, manufactures and sells DC transmission systems on a global market. HVDC technology is used to transmit electricity over long distances and for power transmission via submarine cables. HVDC is also used to connect power grids, e.g., between countries  

  



Are you a person with skills within quality assurance and continues improvement? Then this might be the perfect role for you. As a Production Quality Specialist, you will be a part of a global team that has a passion for continuous improvements and quality assurance. We care and take responsibility in driving the quality to the next level with LEAN Six Sigma principles embedded in our work. The scope of the team is HVDC Valve Manufacturing in all production units, therefore you will get the opportunity to work together with our other factories such as India and China.


**How you´ll make an impact**

* Your main responsibility is quality assurance/quality control in HVDC Valve Manufacturing.
* Ensure the implementation of effective internal quality controls during manufacturing to verify that processes and products will meet customer and stakeholder requirements.
* Govern and improve our QMS and make sure a E2E Quality approach is fulfilled.
* Develop and implement quality improvements and Lessons Learned.
* Strong analytical skills and ability to prioritize and make decisions.
* Performing high quality root cause analysis, identifying, and driving implementation of preventive actions.
* Perform PFMEA and drive improvements to lower quality risks and connecting results to control plans.
Be part in implementing new products and production processes.  
* 

**Your background**

* You hold a university degree in engineering and/or have some years of work experience within quality assurance in manufacturing. Experience from quality assurance for electronics is a plus.
* Good knowledge in Quality Assurance (QA), Quality Control (QC), Quality Management Systems (QMS)
* Background experience within SAP4HANA, MES-Systems, APQP, Lean and experience from using PDCA or similar methodology is preferred.
* Fluent in Swedish and English.
* Good knowledge in Office, non-conformity management tools and statistical software.
* Strong analytical skills and ability to prioritize and make decisions.
We are looking for an engaged and self-driven person who are true team player with a problem-solving oriented and structured mindset.

title: Product Engineer
description:
**Shape the Future of products within Manufacturing**


At Nobia, we’re transforming how kitchens are made. With our new state-of-the-art automated factory in Jönköping (Nobia Park), we’re redefining efficiency, innovation, and sustainability. As a **Product Engineer**, you’ll be at the forefront of this transformation, taking innovative designs and turning them into seamless automated production processes.

**In this role, you’ll:**

* Learn and develop advanced 3D parametric models for automated manufacturing.
* Automate everything from drawings and CNC codes to production data.
* Collaborate with product developers, engineers, and production teams to take concepts to the factory floor.
* Shape and refine templates, troubleshoot challenges, and optimize manufacturing processes.


This is a unique opportunity to be part of a bold journey where your skills will directly impact our cutting-edge production. Using tools like imos based 2020 Insight/Construct software, customized for the furniture industry, you’ll contribute to shaping the future Nobia product offer and the of automation at Nobia.


**What We’re Looking For**  

To succeed in this role, you should have experience with CAD/CAM systems, such as SolidWorks or AutoCAD, and a basic understanding of rulesets and coding, like SQL or VBA. A background in engineering, design, or manufacturing is preferred, with any experience in the furniture industry being a bonus. We value a proactive mindset, problem-solving skills, and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative environment. Fluency in English is required, and knowledge of Swedish is an advantage.

**Why Join Nobia?**  

Our Jönköping factory is more than just a workplace—it’s a hub of innovation where you’ll help define new processes and set best practices in motion. You’ll work in a fast-paced environment alongside passionate, skilled colleagues, with plenty of opportunities to make an impact and grow your career.

**Ready to Shape the Future?**  

If this sounds like your next challenge, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today and be part of Nobia’s journey to revolutionize manufacturing.

 **The Recruitment Process**


To ensure the right fit, we believe in science-based and fair assessment methods. Our recruitment process includes competency-based, structured interviews, where your skills, experience, and attributes relevant to both the role and Nobia will be evaluated. As part of the process, pre-employment testing will be used to help identify candidates most likely to succeed in the role.


We understand that recruitment is a two-way decision and encourage you to ask any questions at any stage of the process.


We look forward to receiving your application! Deadline to apply: **August 10 2025**. For any questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact Jonatan Lindoff, Senior Talent Acquisition Partner at jonatan.lindoff@nobia.com.


For any questions regarding the position , please contact Anders Debel Wehner Category Management Director anders.debel@nobia.com

We are seeking a Trade Compliance Representative to Components that is a key business unit within Hitachi Energy, based in Ludvika, Sweden. We develop, sell and produces Bushings and Tap-Changers, both vital for all Power Transformers. We are part of delivering a safe way of transferring electricity while keeping losses at a minimum. We are proud of our product portfolio, our global customer base as well as our modern production unit.


We are now looking for a driven person for the role as Trade Compliance Representative. In this role you will handle matters such as implementing policies, processes and systems to improve our trade compliance in line with global regulations.
  

  

You will work closely with the Country Trade Compliance Officers as well as different stakeholders on trade related matters, such teams working with inbound and outbound, customs, design, SCM. As a person you know how to connect and build relations both globally and locally both internally and externally.


**Your Responsibilities**

* Ensure that all business transactions (selling and sourcing, direct or indirect business, binding offers, imports, exports, transit trade, of goods, services, software, documents, samples, marketing materials and technology) are carried out in accordance with Corporate Regulation, Standard Operating Procedures, processes and guidelines.
* Long-term Supplier declarations – Collaborate together with our external suppliers to ensure that long-term supplier declarations are available for required article numbers. Collect, compile, follow up and update.
* Export calculations – Perform calculations to ensure compliance with preferential origin.
* Harmonization System Codes (Tariff code) – Responsible for the classification of all items, products and parts with support from technical experts and Trade Compliance Officers. Maintain and update these codes in our business system.
* Country of origin – Ensure that all purchased items in our business systems have the correct country of origin.

title: Staff/Lead Fullstack Engineer (Webapp)
description:
**What We Are Building**
 Mimica's mission is to empower enterprises, teams, and individuals to reclaim their most precious resource — time and work more efficiently, with greater purpose and impact.
   

  

 Our AI-powered task mining observes employee actions across the desktop and categorizes them into detailed process maps. Mimica’s process intelligence highlights inefficiencies, prioritizes improvements based on ROI, recommends the optimal technology for automation (RPA, intelligent document processing, GenAI), and provides a blueprint for building new automations and transforming work.
   

  

**Our approach to engineering**
* We prioritize customer needs first
* We work in small, project-based teams
* We have flexibility in terms of the problems we work on
* We own the full lifecycle of our projects
* We avoid silos and encourage taking up tasks in new areas
* We balance quality and velocity
* We have a shared responsibility for our production code
* We each set our own routine to maximize our productivity


**Your mission**
 In this role, your mission will be to improve and expand the capabilities of the Mimica Web App (MERN stack). This means designing a robust architecture, developing new features, releasing improvements to existing components and taking operational responsibility for what you build. You will seek to understand user needs and pain points, experiment and iterate on your solutions, leveraging tight feedback loops. As a member of our early engineering team, you‘ll have the opportunity to shape our technical direction, processes and culture.
   

  

**Part of your day-to-day**
* Developing a visualization tool and a data-rich dashboard that display process flows and metrics in novel ways.
* Building interfaces and real-time frontend services that enable multiple users to edit graph data and re-train AI models through their input.
* Enabling the auto-generation of process maps and bot code, elevating the experience of the users interacting with task-mining results.
* Participating in architectural decisions, collaborating across teams to identify and implement product improvements and producing documentation for your implementations.
* Providing feedback to peers through pair programming and code reviews and helping those around you to level up.
* Participating in hiring and onboarding new team members; taking on end-to-end project management responsibilities as we grow.


**What You Will Bring**
* Background in frontend or full-stack engineering, with a focus on developing modern, enterprise-class web applications.
* At least 8 years of experience as a Software Engineer and a high technical bar
* Proven experience in architecting high-quality UI components and crafting intuitive interfaces, complex layouts, and interactions that efficiently handle large datasets.
* Proficient in JavaScript, CSS3, and one or more major frontend frameworks or libraries such as React, including comprehensive state management solutions.
* Deep understanding of performance optimization techniques, including: code splitting, lazy loading, efficient asset delivery, and strategies to minimize unnecessary re-renders.
* Knowledge of advanced system design principles, data structures, algorithms, and the core concepts underlying scalable and reliable architectures.
* Commitment to upholding high engineering standards, delivering clean, testable, reusable, modular, and well-documented code.
* Demonstrated analytical and troubleshooting skills –methodically decomposing systems to identify bottlenecks, determine root causes and implement solutions.
* Drive to continually develop your skills, improve team processes and reduce debt.
* Fluency in English, with effective communication skills – articulating complex ideas, concepts and trade-offs clearly.


**Bonus**
* Experience owning projects from start to finish, including speccing, design, development, testing, deployment, release and monitoring.
* Background working in fast-paced, successful scale-up environments or as a founding engineer, with a track record of delivering value quickly and iteratively.
* Active interest in AI, automation, or related fields


**We’d love to hear from you, even if you feel you don’t quite have all of the above.**
**Location**
 This is a fully remote position. You can be based anywhere in the UK,
 **Americas, or Western Europe within a UTC-6 to UTC+1 timezone.**
**What We Offer**
 💰 Generous compensation + stock options — aligned with our internal framework, market data, and individual skills.
   

  

 🏢 Distributed work: Work from anywhere — fully remote, in our hubs, or a mix.
   

  

 💻 Laptop, remote setup stipend, and co-working budget
   

  

 📍 Flexible schedules and location
   

  

 ☀️ Ample paid time off, in addition to local public holidays
   

  

 🍼 Enhanced parental leave
   

  

 🧘‍♀️ Health and retirement benefits
   

  

 📖 Annual L&D budget
   

  

 🌴 Annual workaways and regular virtual & in-person socials
   

  

 🌍 Opportunity to contribute to groundbreaking projects that shape the future of work
   

  

*Note: Some benefits may vary depending on location*

description:

 with deep expertise in the

 , including

 ,

 In this role, you'll be instrumental in shaping high-performance, reliable, and maintainable web applications, working across the full stack and deploying solutions to the cloud using

 .
 



  





**Key responsibilities:** 



* **Own the code:** 
 Design, develop, and maintain scalable full stack applications using Typescript, Node.js, React or Angular.
* **Take the Lead:** 
 Optimize application performance and scalability for high traffic environments.
* **Bridge the Gaps:** 
 Collaborate closely with tech lead and other engineers to create seamless user experience.
* **Architect the Future:** 
 Integrate APIs, manage data flows, and build backend/frontend services with attention to maintainability and security.
* **Deliver with Impact:** 
 Leverage AWS services for deployment, scalability, and monitoring and participate in code reviews and contribute to engineering best practices.



  





**We are looking for someone with:** 



* 5+ years of experience in full stack development.
* Proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript, React or Angular, Redux, and Node.js.
* Strong knowledge of Nest.js or similar backend frameworks.
* Solid understanding of RESTful APIs, microservice architecture, and CI/CD pipelines.
* Experience working with AWS (e.g., Lamda, S3, EC2, API Gateway).
* Excellent team player



  





**You’ll have us extra excited if you are experienced in:** 



* Working with SQL databases
* System Architecture
* DevOps process and tools such as Jenkins
* Test Driven Development
* Working with any 3D libraries such as Pixi.JS
* Agile methodology
* iGaming industry



  





**Life at Relax** 




 Relax is at a very exciting growth stage as a company; however, we cherish our informal and flexible core atmosphere where self-initiative, taking pride in what you do and ambition to deliver the best results are key components. For the right person, there are endless opportunities for personal and professional development.
 







**About Relax Gaming** 




 Relax Gaming Group was founded in 2010 with the goal of creating games for the modern iGaming landscape. Always staying true to the Relax core values - Driven, Adaptable, Supportive, and Respectful - the recent and rapid expansion has been conceived in order to deliver unparalleled global reach. Via a quick one-time integration, Relax Gaming now provides access to a roster of 1500+ casino games and a diverse range of proprietary products, including Poker, Bingo, and its own rapidly expanding slot portfolio.
 



  





 The high-quality aggregated content is provided through its selected Silver Bullet (commercially represented) and Powered By Relax (commercially independent) partners. Regulated markets are also at the heart of its growth strategy, with both fully supported regulated markets as well as licenses held in multiple jurisdictions. Keen to find out more? Learn about us here.

title: Sap Advanced Business Application Programming Developer
description: As a SAP S4HANA developer you will be responsible for the design, development, testing and support of ABAP objects being developed in S/4 HANA greenfield implementation project. A professional at this position level has the following responsibilities:oWork closely with SAP functional consultant to deliver, maintain, troubleshoot and enhance SAP functionality.oBuilds professional relationships with team members and clients, to ensure delivery of proposed solutions.oGood knowledge on any of the SAP Functional area eg; EAM, P2P, FICO, O2C, MM etc.Good understanding and experience of process changes in new S/4 HANA Implementation along with clean core and cloud ready approach.oPractical implementation exposure on CDS Views and RAP frameworkoGood practical experience on Key user extensibility and on-stack developer extensibility.oGood Exposure in RICEF objects, Workflow, Webdynpro, OData, ADT, Eclipse, SP Upgrades and ABAP unit testing frameworkoGood understanding on released API?s and best practices on building custom Fiori applications by using the Fiori elements templates.oExperience working on BAS as well as Fiori.Strong understanding of the UI principlesoExperience in Fiori Launchpad configurationoExperience on OPD Forms

title: Data Engineer
description:
We are excited to welcome our next Data Engineer to our Internal Data & Analytics team where your colleagues will be: Ilaf, Jesper, Patrik, Magnus and our next Head of Data & Analytics. If you’re a curious and proactive person who enjoy taking iniatives, connect data and business needs then this might be just the role for you.
   

  

 This is a great opportunity for someone with a few years of experience who wants to grow their technical and strategic skills in a role where data is starting to play a bigger role in company-wide decision-making.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 At Voyado, internal BI is still in an exciting building phase. You’ll help us shape how data is structured, accessed, and used- working both hands-on with data pipelines and collaboratively with stakeholders across the business.
   

  

 Your day-to-day will include:
   

  

* Designing and maintaining BI solutions in SQL, helping teams make smarter decisions
* Working closely with the business to gather requirements, understand use cases, and define the right datasets
* Supporting the transition to self-service reporting by enabling teams with scalable, trusted data models
* Creating integrations and handling data flows from source systems to dashboards (ETL/ELT)
* Being involved from data extraction all the way to naming and structuring the datasets- you won’t be handed pre-packaged solutions
* Taking ownership of smaller BI projects and collaborating in our quarterly BI forum where business needs are prioritized


**Who You Are**
 We believe you have around 2–3 years of experience in a data-related role and are now ready for more ownership and broader influence. You have a problem-solving mindset, enjoy figuring things out, and feel confident working independently.
   

  

 You might describe yourself as someone who:
   

  

* Likes to initiate, ask questions, and explore what’s possible, not just execute defined tasks
* Enjoys working across teams and building relationships with stakeholders from different parts of the organization
* Can translate business needs into structured data and define what a good dataset should look like
* Thrives when things aren’t fully set yet. you like being part of building and improving processes
* Is comfortable working with SQL, Azure, Git, Power BI, and open to learning more (Databricks and Python are nice-to-haves)


 What's in it for you?
   

  

 Voyado wouldn’t be the powerful platform it is without the people behind it. We really care for our Voyadoers and some examples of what we can offer you are:
   

  

* An engaged team with a knowledge-sharing and friendly culture
* Summits where we hang out, workshop, discuss, and have a good time together
* Opportunities for personal and professional growth and learning in a dynamic and supportive environment.
* Work-life balance – we don't have a long work-hours culture, we value engagement over hours worked.
* An office-first but flexible hybrid working policy.


 Some of our benefits:
   

  

* 30 days of vacation, so you can spend time on the things you love
* Beneficial bike lease, including e-bikes
* Breakfast buffet on Fridays
* Inhouse gym only for Voyadoers
* A generous gadget-and-phone package (your choice!)
* 5000 SEK per year in wellness allowance
* A wellness hour you can use every week


**About Voyado**
 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, Voyado makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their own businesses.
   

  

 We are now a company of 300+ colleagues on an exciting journey and have recently established a presence in new markets to strengthen our position in Europe. If you are ready for your next adventure and want to join our team on our expansion throughout Europe and have an interest in customer care, e-commerce, retail, and tech - let's get in touch!
   

  

****Be yourself 🏳️‍🌈****
 At Voyado, we believe in gender equality. We are proud sponsors of Womengineer as well as Tjejer Kodar! Read more about Tjejer Kodar & Voyado here
   

  

  

  

 Equality is not only about gender but also about making everyone feel welcome and heard in a multicultural and diverse environment. We at Voyado strive to make everyone feel like they can bring their true self to work every day. Gender-equal and diverse teams have more perspectives on life and bring different ideas to the table which in the end leads not only to making a better working environment but also a better product.
   

  

 Ready to find out more?
   

  

 Lovely! 🎉
   

  

*Before one applies it can always feel like you need a better resume, more polish, or just another year of experience, but we say if you think this sounds like a place where you can shine don't hesitate to send in your resume!*
 We'd love to get to know you and understand what makes you tick, so write a few lines about what you enjoy about your current role and what would be an exciting challenge for you in the future. We are eager to get to know you and what you love to do, so be yourself and let your passion shine through in your application!
   

  

*Note: As of right now we are unable to proceed with applicants outside of the EU, and a requirement of eligibility to work at Voyado is the right to work in the EU without limitations. Needless to say, this is something we are actively working on to be able to onboard colleagues from all over the world.*
 Voyado is the customer experience platform made for retail. We help brands turn every interaction—from first click to repeat purchase—into lasting loyalty.
   

  

 With AI-powered tools for search, personalization, marketing, and loyalty, we make it easy for retailers to grow and connect with customers in smarter ways.
   

  

 Loved by 400+ brands, Voyado is on a mission to become Europe’s most beloved retail companion.

title: Embeddedutvecklare
description:
TMC i Stockholm växer och vi söker fler Embeddedutvecklare till vårt team Digital & IT!
   

  

**About This Vacancy**
 På TMC blir du en del av en innovativ och entreprenöriell organisation där fokuset ligger på ständig utveckling och möjligheten att vara ansvarig för din egen utveckling och affär. I rollen som Embeddedutvecklare söker vi dig som är en engagerad lagspelare som vill vara med och utveckla system och produkter inom olika områden tillsammans med våra kunder runt om i StorStockholm. Dina arbetsuppgifter kan inkludera exempelvis; kravanalys, systemdesign, integration, testning, verifiering, felsökning, optimering, dokumentation och nära samarbete med andra ingenjörer.
   

  

**What We Expect From You**
 Som person är du noggrann och du behöver kunna omsätta idéer och koncept till praktiska och fungerande lösningar genom design, teknisk analys och samarbete med olika intressenter. Vi lägger stor vikt vid ditt personliga engagemang och din vilja att driva din utveckling framåt. Då man arbetar med ständiga förbättringar är detta något som du drivs av och tycker är intressant.
   

  

**Krav För Rollen Är Att Du Har**
* En akademisk ingenjörsexamen inom maskinteknik, elektronik, inbyggda system, datavetenskap eller liknande (Minst BSc, meriterande om MSc).
* Arbetat i minst 5 år med embeddedutveckling och integration av komplexa system
* Goda kunskaper inom systemarkitektur, testning, verifiering, C, C++ och Python
* Kunskaper i svenska och engelska obehindrat i tal och skrift


**What You Can Expect From Us**
 I rollen som Employeneur får du både utveckla dina tekniska kunskaper och driva din egen utveckling och affär. Du blir del av en innovativ och entreprenöriell organisation där fokuset ligger på ständig utveckling och möjligheten att vara fullt ansvarig för att styra din egen karriär.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid ditt personliga engagemang och din vilja att driva din utveckling framåt. För att lyckas med det ges du chansen att själv påverka vilken typ av projekt du tar dig an samt vilken kompetensutveckling du vill investera i. Du styr din karriär helt enkelt.
   

  

 Eftersom TMC är ett internationellt företag kan vi erbjuda projekt på olika platser i olika länder där vi och våra kunder finns. För närvarande finns vi representerade i Sverige, Nederländerna, Belgien, Frankrike, Tyskland, Luxemburg, Spanien, Portugal, Italien, Ungern, U.A.E., Mexiko, USA och Kanada. Du får världen som arbetsplats!

title: Mjukvaruutvecklare inom fordonsindustrin
description:
Jobbeskrivning
   

  

**Mjukvaruutvecklare inom fordonsindustrin – bidra till framtidens mobilitet**
 AFRY driver innovation i gränslandet mellan teknik, hållbarhet och samhällsutveckling. I takt med att fordonsindustrin genomgår en omfattande teknologisk förändring spelar vi en viktig roll i att forma framtidens mobilitet – med människan i centrum.
   

  

 Med gedigen kompetens inom uppkopplade system, inbyggd mjukvara och funktionell säkerhet är vi med och utvecklar nästa generations infotainmentsystem, telematiklösningar och avancerade förarassistanssystem (ADAS) – inklusive autonoma funktioner.
   

  

 Nu växer vårt Automotive Engineering-team, och vi söker dig som vill vara med och göra skillnad i en bransch i ständig utveckling.
   

  

**Din roll hos oss**
 Som mjukvaruutvecklare blir du en del av ett tvärfunktionellt team där samarbete, kunskapsdelning och gemensamt lärande är centralt. Tillsammans utvecklar och integrerar vi mjukvara och system för elektrifierade drivlinor, ADAS, infotainment och uppkopplade fordon. Vi arbetar både i nära samverkan med våra kunder och i projekt som drivs från våra egna kontor.
   

  

**I Din Roll Kommer Du Bland Annat Att**
* Designa, implementera och testa inbyggd mjukvara för fordonssystem
* Arbeta med realtidsoperativsystem (RTOS) och AUTOSAR-arkitektur
* Integrera mjukvara med hårdvarunära komponenter och säkerställa att systemen uppfyller krav på funktionell säkerhet (ISO 26262)
* Samarbeta med kollegor inom elektronik, systemdesign, test och cybersäkerhet
* Bidra till tekniska lösningar i nära dialog med kunder – ofta globala OEM:er och Tier-1-leverantörer
* Hålla dig uppdaterad inom ny teknik som 5G, AI, datorseende och V2X-kommunikation
* Vi tror att du har:
* En kandidatexamen inom teknik, datavetenskap, informationssystem eller motsvarande
* Minst fem års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling inom inbyggda system


 Kvalifikationer
   

  

**Erfarenhet från några av följande områden är värdefullt:**
* Programmering i C, C++, Java eller Python
* Drivrutinsutveckling i RTOS-miljöer
* Mjukvaruutveckling inom AUTOSAR
* Kunskap om SoC-komponenter som klockor, PLL:er, GPIO, avbrottshanterare och kringutrustning (SPI, I2C, PCIe, CAN, Ethernet, USB, UFS), samt strömhantering
* Utveckling av inbyggda multimediaprodukter för Android eller nätverksbaserade system inom grafik, video, kamera, display eller datorseende
* Kännedom om ISO 26262 och funktionell säkerhet


**Meriterande Är Även Erfarenhet Av**
* Multiprocessorarkitekturer, ARM-processorer, cachehantering och avbrott
* Virtualiseringstekniker kopplade till CPU och minneshantering


 Hos AFRY får du möjlighet att växa i en miljö där teknik möter omtanke, och där din kompetens får ta plats. Vi tror på kraften i mångfald, samarbete och långsiktigt lärande – och vi ser fram emot att höra hur just du vill bidra.
   

  

 Företagsbeskrivning
   

  

**AFRY erbjuder tjänster inom teknik, design, digitalisering och rådgivning. Vi är engagerade experter inom industri-, energi- och infrastruktursektorerna och skapar värde för kommande generationer. AFRY har nordiska rötter med global räckvidd. Följ med oss i att påskynda omställningen mot ett hållbart samhälle.**
**Om Automotive East**
 Automotive East, med placering i Södertälje/Solna, verkar i en verkligt internationell miljö och samarbetar med flera platser världen över, inklusive Brasilien, Indien och Göteborg. Vi stöttar våra kunder med expertis inom design, teknik och inbyggda system – både genom interna projekt och på plats hos kund. Automotive East erbjuder konsulttjänster till fordonsindustrin och bidrar genuint till en mer hållbar framtid genom att skapa smartare och mer hållbara fordon.
   

  

 Fordonsindustrin genomgår just nu en stor omställning, där fordon i allt högre grad utvecklas för att bli mer autonoma och elektrifierade. Denna förändring syftar till att skapa en hållbar transportsektor för framtiden – och Automotive East befinner sig i hjärtat av denna spännande utveckling.
   

  

**Teamkultur**
 På Automotive East värdesätter vi en stöttande och inkluderande teamkultur där alla känner sig hörda och uppskattade. Våra team bygger på ömsesidig respekt, samarbete och en gemensam passion för innovation. Vi uppmuntrar till öppen kommunikation och idéutbyte, eftersom vi vet att mångfald av perspektiv leder till bättre lösningar. Hos oss får du möjlighet att växa både professionellt och personligt, med kontinuerligt lärande och utveckling. Vi firar framgångar tillsammans och stöttar varandra genom utmaningar – vilket skapar en positiv och trivsam arbetsmiljö. Skratt och gemenskap är en naturlig del av vår vardag, vilket gör Automotive East till mer än bara en arbetsplats – det är en plats att trivas och utvecklas på.
   

  

 Ytterligare information
   

  

 Vi erbjuder dig en position i ett företag där skapandet av nya idéer uppmuntras och innovationer tas vidare. Vårt arbete är krävande, men det åtföljs av frihet – frihet att utvecklas och lära sig, samt att kombinera yrkes- och privatliv till en givande helhet.
   

  

 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan, sista ansökningsdag är
 **2025-08-10**
 Observera att urval sker löpande, men på grund av semestertider kan återkoppling på din ansökan komma att dröja till efter sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 Glöm inte att uppdatera relevant information för denna tjänst i ditt CV.
   

  

 Vi accepterar endast ansökningar genom detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på "Apply now"-knappen. Ansökningar via e-post kommer inte att beaktas.
   

  

 Kontaktuppgifter för frågor
   

  

 Rekryterande chef
   

  

**Johan Krii** 
 , Service Area Manager
   

  

 johan.krii@afry.com
   

  

 Vi ber vänligen att inte bli kontaktade av bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag eller säljare som erbjuder ytterligare platsannonser.
   

  

*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*

title: Manufacturing Execution System (MES) Engineer
description:
TMC i Stockholm växer och vi söker Manufacturing Execution System (MES) Engineer till vårt team Digital & IT!
   

  

**About This Vacancy**
 På TMC blir du en del av en innovativ och entreprenöriell organisation där fokuset ligger på ständig utveckling och möjligheten att vara ansvarig för din egen utveckling och affär. I rollen som Manufacturing Execution System (MES) Engineer söker vi dig som är en engagerad lagspelare som vill bidra till en omfattande digital transformation tillsammans med våra kunder i StorStockholm där du kommer att agera brygga mellan IT, automation och verksamheten. Dina arbetsuppgifter kan exempelvis inkludera; förvaltning, implementering och integrering mellan produktionssystem och affärssystem (ERP/MES/SCADA), modernisering av systemlandskapet, kravhantering, tekniska diskussioner och samarbete med andra produkt- och leveransteam.

Vi lägger stor vikt vid ditt personliga engagemang och din vilja att driva din utveckling framåt. Då man arbetar med ständiga förbättringar är detta något som du drivs av och tycker är intressant.

* En akademisk ingenjörsexamen inom produktion, systemvetenskap, datavetenskap, inbyggda system eller liknande (Minst BSc, meriterande om MSc).
* Arbetat i några år med systemutveckling och integration av komplexa system
* God erfarenhet av PLC/SCADA-system, särskilt Ignition, SIMATIC WinCC, TIA Portal eller liknande
* Erfarenhet av att framgångsrikt ha implementerat storskaliga lösningar

**What You Can Expect From Us**
 I rollen som Employeneur får du både utveckla dina tekniska kunskaper och driva din egen utveckling och affär. Du blir del av en innovativ och entreprenöriell organisation där fokuset ligger på ständig utveckling och möjligheten att vara fullt ansvarig för att styra din egen karriär.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid ditt personliga engagemang och din vilja att driva din utveckling framåt. För att lyckas med det ges du chansen att själv påverka vilken typ av projekt du tar dig an samt vilken kompetensutveckling du vill investera i. Du styr din karriär helt enkelt.
   

  

 Eftersom TMC är ett internationellt företag kan vi erbjuda projekt på olika platser i olika länder där vi och våra kunder finns. För närvarande finns vi representerade i Sverige, Nederländerna, Belgien, Frankrike, Tyskland, Luxemburg, Spanien, Portugal, Italien, Ungern, U.A.E., Mexiko, USA och Kanada. Du får världen som arbetsplats!
